texts.en: Yati is 23 years old and has a 6 year old child. She raises chickens  at her home.  She sells them every three months and earns US$25. Her husband, W., is a driver who earns US$1.5 per day. She is requesting a loan to expand her business and willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Nana

texts.en: Nana is 30 years old and has a 13-year-old child. She buys and sells plastics. She usually earns $3 per day. Her husband, J., is a laborer who earns $2 per day. She has to work hard to earn extra income for the family. She is requesting a loan of $100 to buy more plastics which will increase her sales and expand her business . She will repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Rukiah

texts.en: Rukiah is 32 years old and has an 11 year old child.  She has been selling kerosene and  clothes on credit. She can earn US $20 per day. Her husband, S., is a driver with no regular income. She requests a loan to buy more goods and expand her business because it is the only source of income for the family. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Maria Del Socorro

texts.es:
Mrs. Maria del Socorro U. M. is 41, originally from the city of Bluefields. She is married to Francisco González and they have 2 children. Mrs. U. is the proprietor of a section of used clothing and has 3 years´ business experience. Her clients are men and women of all ages, with limited resources, who prefer to buy used clothing for their children from her because of the variety she offers. Mrs. U. would like to buy a parcel of used children´s clothing this month because of higher demand. The parcel costs US$300 and has 350 pieces. With this investment, she will be able to meet the demand.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

La Sra. Maria del Socorro U. M. tiene 41 años de edad, es originaria de la ciudad de Bluefields esta casada con el Sr. Francisco González ambos tienen 2 hijos. La Sra. U. es propietaria de un tramo de ropa usada, tiene 3 años de experiencia, sus clientes son mujeres y hombres de todas las edades, de escasos recursos que les compran ropa a sus hijos, que la prefieren por ofrecer variedad de ropa usada. La Sra. U. necesita comprar un paquete de ropa usada para niño porque en este mes hay mayor demanda, el paquete cuesta US$ 300.00 dólares y tiene 350 piezas, con esta inversión podrá satisfacer la demanda.

loans.use: Purchase a parcel of used children´s clothing.

payments.comment: Estapagando las cuotas nº 4 y 5. Esta cancelando su credito.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To invest in printing paper, ink cartridges, and women's shoes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more clothing to sell to her customers

loans.name: Please

texts.es: Client posted twice by mistake.

loans.use: Para comprar mas mercaderia y poder asi atender a mas clientes

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
Teresa is 44 years old and a mother of four. She used to work hard to sell groceries, which also generated no income because there was no big supply and demand for these products in her city. Three years ago, she gave up selling groceries. Now, she sells clothing to various houses: she sells clothing seasonally, leaving her customers the products and getting paid at her next return visit. She works in the same company her husband Juan Manuel works. He is also responsible for the administration of bill collection from his customers every 30 days. Teresa, like all mothers, wishes that her children become professionally successful. That is why she works very hard with dedication to this job. Currently, she has her own store which is not used because there are many repairs that need to be done to display her clothing. With this goal to refurbish this place, establish her business, and sell her products, she seeks a loan to develop and utilize the space that she has. With your help, Teresa will be able to materialize her goal in a short time.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Volunteer.

Teresa de 44 años de edad, madre con cuatro hijos, se dedicaba a la venta de abarrotes, el mismo que no lo produjo ningún ingreso económico ya que existe una gran oferta y demanda de estos productos en su ciudad; hace tres años dejó la venta de abarrotes y ahora se dedica a la venta de prendas de vestir a domicilio, éstas las ofrece deacuerdo a las temporadas dejándolas con un compromiso de pago a su retorno y próxima visita; trabaja en compañía de su esposo, Juan Manuel, quien también se encarga de administrar los cobros que realizan sus clientes cada treinta días..Teresa, como toda madre desea que sus hijos se conviertan en profesionales exitosos, y por esa razón con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación se encamina más a fondo en esta labor. Actualmente cuenta con un local propio el cual no es utilizado debido a que le falta muchos arreglos y sobre todo implementos para una adecuada demostración de sus prendas.Con el objetivo de establecerse en este lugar y comercializar sus productos de manera permanente, solicita un préstamo para invertirlos en la adecuación e implementación del espacio que posee. Con tu gentil apoyo Doña Teresa podrá concretar en corto tiempo su propósito.

loans.use: to fix up her store

loans.name: Clara

texts.es:
Clara is 40 years old, teaches at a secondary school and has three daughters. In order to give them wellbeing and security, she acquired two motocarros, light delivery vans with three wheels, a long time ago with the crucial help and support of her loving husband. Currently her greatest dream is to implement a general store and enlarge the structure of the store in order to open a commercial store and also offer traditional cuisine. Eulogio, her husband, supports her in all her activities and, above all, in the goals that she has proposed. Clara, who has shown her desire to improve and her immense desire to make progress, requests a loan to invest in the purchase of products and expansion of the structure in her home in order to set up and increase her new channels of business. She hopes for your unselfish help from your noble hearts.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Clara tiene 40 años, ella es profesora de educación secundaria y tiene tres hijas, y a fin de otorgarles bienestar y seguridad hace mucho tiempo ha adquirido dos motocarros con la importante ayuda y apoyo de su querido esposo. Actualmente su sueño máximo es implementar una bodega y aumentar la estructura del mismo para aperturar una tienda comercial de manera adicional también ofrece platos típicos. Eulogio, su esposo, la apoya en todas sus actividades y sobre todo en las metas que ella se ha propuesto. Clara nos muestra su esmero por mejorar y sus inmensas ganas de progresar, solicita un préstamo para invertirlos en la compra de productos y en la ampliación de la estructura de su hogar para instalar e incrementar sus nuevas líneas de acción. Ella espera por la ayuda desinteresada de tu noble corazón.

loans.use: Buy more products for her general store, expansion of her house in order to establish a commercial store

loans.name: Milagros

texts.es:
Milagros, 25 years old, along with her husband Hernán, found themselves in the business of retail gas distribution, a good part of the family income. Due to her great ability and skill in this trade, Milagros took a loan from the communal bank, to invest solely in the purchase of gas canisters. As the loan wasn’t enough to cover the fuel for the canisters, little by little and with a lot of perseverance she was able to fund her investment. Her husband, having observed the great efforts of his beloved companion, decided to take charge of the door-to-door delivery, as every little bit of their earnings and savings that they could make would be for the benefit of their beloved children of one and six years of age. In spite of this, Milagros wants to keep making progress and take advantage of every one of the opportunities the business presents, with the goal of elevating her family’s standard of living. For this reason she rented a space to facilitate the distribution of not only this important fuel, but also soft drinks. Milagros needs capital that would allow her to improve the environment in her shop, buy more gas canisters, and above all, buy fuel. Let’s help this mother with such talent, ability and effort to keep working hard in order to make progress.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Milagros de 25 años de edad junto a su esposo, Hernán, encontró en el negocio de distribución de gas al por menor una gran fuente de ingreso familiar. Milagros por su gran habilidad y destreza en este rubro se hizo un préstamo de un banco comunal, para invertirlos sólo en la compra de balones de gas ya que el mismo no cubría para el combustible, poco a poco y con mucha perseverancia logró consolidar su pequeña inversión. Su esposo observando el gran esfuerzo de su querida compañera decidió encargarse de la repartición a los domicilios a fin de que cada una de las ganancias y ahorros que puedan mantener sea para el beneficio de sus queridos hijos de uno y seis años de edad. A pesar de esto quiere seguir adelante y aprovechar cada una de las oportunidades de negocio que se le presente a fin de elevar el nivel de vida de su querida familia, por esta razón rentó un local para facilitar la distribución no sólo de este importante combustible sino también de bebidas gaseosas, por lo que necesariamente necesita de un capital que le permita mejorar los ambientes de su local, comprar mas balones de gas y sobre todo el combustible. Apoyemos a esta madre que con su talento, habilidad y esfuerzo sigue trabajando arduamente para progresar.

loans.use: Buy gas canisters and improve the structure of her storefront.

loans.name: Robert

texts.es:
Robert is a 22-year-old student in a prestigious university in the city and dedicates himself to selling many styles and colors of men's and women's shoes. The desire to have his own funds has caused him to engage in a variety of commercial activities from a young age, and he hasn't done poorly because now he is a good merchant of shoes of all brands and occasionally sells door to door. For Robert, there are no limits on his work and studies, and already his classmates from the university e attends are those who buy products from his shoe store. Besides being a good student and a good son, he uses his small income to purchase food for his family and pay for his studies. He wants to finish his work and show many young people that we can reach what we set out to do. That's why Susana and Americo, Robert's parents, are very proud of him. He has a goal to expand into clothing sales because many of his clients have requested that he do this. We support this young student who wants to progress and collaborate in supporting his home.

Translated by Princeton University Language Project.

Robert de 22 años de edad es estudiante de una prestigiosa universidad de su ciudad, se dedica a a la venta de zapatos de diversos modelos y colores para hombres y mujeres.Los anhelos de conseguir sus propios ingresos hicieron que desde muy joven se introduzca en diversas actividades comerciales y no lo hizo mal, porque ahora es un gran vendedor de zapatos de todas las marcas y en ocasiones los ofrece también de puerta en puerta.Para Robert no existe limites para su trabajo y estudios ya que son los mismos estudiantes de la universidad a la que él asiste los que compran sus productos de zapatería.Él además de ser un buen alumno es un buen hijo, ya que aporta sus pocos ingresos a la alimentación de su familia y el pago de sus estudios ya que desea terminar su profesión y demostrar a muchos jóvenes que si se podemos conseguir lo que nos proponemos.Es por ello que Susana y Américo, padres de Robert, se encuentran muy orgullosos de él. Tiene una meta, incursionar en la venta de prendas de vestir, debido a que por el buen gusto que tiene sus clientes le han solicitado que incursione en esta actividad y desde ya cuenta con una amplia lista de pedidos.Apoyemos a este joven estudiante que desea progresar y colaborar con el buen sostenimiento de su hogar.

loans.use: Purchase of materials for a shoe and clothing  store

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
Maribel is 40 years old, has three children and makes a living selling clothing of all brands and colors for males and females, children and adults. Thanks to the support of her family, who lives in the city of Lima, she began selling garments being that her siblings sent them to her for her children as presents. She found an excellent source of income in this opportunity, and her immense wishes of self-improvement led her to also dedicate herself to the sale of motorcycle spare parts thanks to the extensive support and knowledge of her loving husband, Wilson. He has always provided advice and support so that she benefits from each of her initiatives and remains happy. To Maribel nothing is impossible, and for that reason she needs capital in the form of a loan to consolidate her small sales space. Let’s make Maribel’s wish come true. With your collaboration and polite support, she will materialize her goals in a very short time.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Maribel de 40 años de edad, tiene tres hijos, se dedica a la venta de ropas de todas las marcas y colores para niños y adultos de ambos sexos, gracias al apoyo de su familia que reside en la ciudad de lima, ella empezó a vender ropas puesto que sus hermanos se las enviaban para sus pequeños a manera de obsequios.Ella encontró en esta oportunidad una excelente fuente de ingreso económico y sus inmensos deseos de superación la llevaron también a dedicarse a la venta de repuestos para motocicletas gracias al inmenso apoyo y conocimientos de su querido esposo.Wilson, su esposo, siempre le ha otorgado consejos y apoyo a fin de que cada una de sus iniciativas la mantengan contenta y sea provechosa.Para Maribel no existe nada imposible y por esa razón necesita de un capital dde inversión para consolidar sus pequeños espacios de ventas.Hagamos que se cumpla el deseo de Maribel con tu colaboración y tu gentil apoyo podrá concretar en poco tiempo su propósito.

loans.use: Purchase capital to consolidate her small clothing sales business.

loans.name: Alvina

texts.es:
Alvina is a 57-year-old single woman who is a nursing technician. At the same time, for the past 10 years she is devoted to selling cold drinks from her humble home. She lives with her sister Rosario, who helps her out when she is doing her noble work at the city´s hospital. Rosario is in charge of taking care of the house, which is why they decided to open this small business together, as the demand that exists allows them to have an additional income. Alvina is a very affectionate woman and cares for Rosario´s grandchildren as if she were their own mother. She wants to improve the environment in her house for the placement of all their products. Help support Alvina so that her proposal is fulfilled and she can have a prosperous and tranquil life.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer.

Alvina, de estado civil soltera, tiene 57 años de edad, es técnica en enfermería y a la vez se dedica a la venta de bebidas heladas desde hace diez años desde las humildes instalaciones de su hogar, vive con su hermana Rosario, quien la ayuda con las ventas cuando Alvina está desempeñando su noble oficio en el hospital de su ciudad, y es quién se encarga de las labores de su hogar, es por eso que juntas decidieron aperturar este pequeño negocio ya por la demanda que existe les brindaría un ingreso económico adicional.Ella es una mujer muy cariñosa ya que tiene a su cuidado a los nietos de Rosario y los atiende como una verdadera madre. Desea mejorar los ambientes de su casa para la ubicación correspondiente de todos sus productos.Apoyemos a Alvina para que su propósito se cumpla y pueda tener una vida próspera y tranquila.

loans.use: Purchase greater quantity and variety of drinks.

loans.name: Ena

texts.es:
Ena Rosa is a 52-year-old widow who currently lives alone now that all of her children have left home to settle down in different cities with families of their own. She is proud that her children have stayed out of trouble using good sense and use all the lessons and values she taught each of them while they lived with her. For a long time, she has dedicated her self to the art of textile and making suits, linens, costumes, etc. Losing her husband was very painful for her and she had to find refuge and solace in this work and used it to provide for herself. Because of her skill in the textile field, she works in a very well-known store in the area, but this results in neglect of her house. She has opened her own textile shop in her sister’s house and is using this opportunity to its fullest potential since she already has good clientele. For her, the only way to live without worries is working and for this reason she hopes to establish her own textile company and for this she needs an investment which will allow her to buy the necessary tools to start up her project. Let’s help this strong, talented mother continue working to progress.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia, Princeton University Language Project volunteer.

Ena Rosa de 52 años de edad es viuda, en la actualidad vive sola ya que todos sus hijos dejaron el seno de su hogar para establecerse en diferentes ciudades con sus propias familias y el más grande orgullo para ella es saber que sus hijos se desempeñan con mucha cordura y ponen en práctica cada uno de las enseñanzas y valores que ha inculcado en cada uno de ellos durante su permanencia en casa.Desde hace mucho tiempo se dedicaba al arte textil y a la confección de trajes, lencerías, disfraces, etc. Para ella fue muy doloroso perder a su esposo y tuvo que encontrar refugio y consuelo en esta ocupación a fin de sustentar sus necesidades con satisfacción. Gracias a su destreza y habilidades en este campo textil trabajó en una tienda muy conocida en la zona, pero eso causaba el descuido de su vivienda, ahora abrió su propia textilería en casa de su hermana y esta aprovechando al máximo esta oportunidad ya que tiene una buena clientela.Para ella la única forma de vivir tranquila sin preocupaciones es trabajando y por esa razón anhela establecer su propia empresa textil y para ello necesita de un capital de dinero que le permita adquirir las herramientas necesarias para poner en marcha su proyecto.Apoyemos a esta madre que con talento y esfuerzo sigue trabajando arduamente para progresar.

loans.use: Purchase of materials for manufacture (Lace, cloth, buttons, clasps, etc)

loans.name: Ida

texts.es:
Ida Luz, who is 48 years old, is a single mother of two children. Her 22-year old daughter is a college student and her 14-year old son is at studying at a prestigious secondary school in their city. Both children support their mother in everything she does. Ida Luz is also caring for her father Carlos S. who is 85 years old, retired, and at his advanced age needs the care of his loving daughter. When Ida was in school she studied jewelry making and for a long time she dedicated herself to the art. The benefit of this has been that she has been able to provide wellbeing and security to her children for a long time. Despite not having an appropriate shop, Ida formed a small center, along with a group of single mothers, to impart her knowledge and teach others the art. As time passed the group progressed and her students began to benefit medically and psychologically, thanks to Ida’s friendly oversight. Nonetheless, it all disintegrated due to her housing arrangement, and since then she has only been working at a conventional job making shoes, fine costume jewelry, and, as she is a good weaver, she makes singles, woven sandals and straps. She longs to start another club with the goal of helping these unselfish mothers and, most importantly, provide them with amenities and materials so they can learn and contribute to a better quality of life for their families. She also wants to open a store, and for each of these plans, she needs investment capital. She appeals to your generous hearts to obtain the amount she requests so she may put her plans into action. Her request will make it possible for many more mothers in Pucallpa to obtain rapidly redeeming and beneficial work.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

Ida Luz, tiene 48 años de edad, es madre soltera con dos hijos. Su hija de 22 años es estudiante universitaria y su hijo de 14 años cursa estudios secundarios en un prestigioso centro educativo de su ciudad, ambos hijos apoyan en todo a su madre; también está a cargo a su papá don Carlos S. de 85 años, quien es Jubilado y por su avanzada edad necesita de los cuidados de su cariñosa hija. Ida en un centro ocupacional estudió bijoutería y desde hace mucho tiempo se dedica a este arte y con su desempeño a podido brindarle bienestar y seguridad a sus hijos durante mucho tiempo; a pesar de no tener un local apropiado Ida formó junto a un grupo de madres solteras un pequeño centro para impartir sus conocimientos y enseñarles este arte, con el transcurrir del tiempo su sociedad progresaba y sus alumnas empezaron a gozar también de atenciones médicas y psicológicas, gracias a las gestiones amistosas de Ida; sin embargo todo este afán se desintegró por el arreglo de su vivienda, desde entonces sólo se dedica a su trabajo convencional de fabricación de zapatos y joyerías de fantasía fina, a su vez es una buena tejedora ya que hace también individuales, sandalias tejidas y correas. Anhela volver a constituir otro club a fin de ayudar a estas madres desinteresadamente y lo más importante brindarles comodidad y materiales para que estas puedan aprender y contribuir a mejorar la calidad de vida de sus familias, también tiene el propósito de abrir una tienda y para cada uno de estos planes necesita de un capital de inversión, recurre a tu bondadoso corazón a fin de obtener la cantidad que solicita para poner en marcha sus planes. Posibilitemos su petición para que muchas más madres en Pucallpa obtengan una labor de desempeño rápido y provechoso.

loans.use: Buy materials for jewelry-making (stones, special wire, thread, nylon, Corrospun)

loans.name: Florinda

texts.es:
Florinda is a nurse by profession. She is 47 years old and has two children ages 17 and 11. She suffered considerably after her separation from her husband, and she now carries out the roles of father and mother simultaneously. In actuality, she has a new engagement with whom she shares all her ideas, and she feels very happy with his help, support and understanding. The most important thing to her is to see her children content and satisfied, which is why she excels in her professional job and in her business.

For a very long time now, she has been dedicating her time to the art of bijouterie, and to clothing and beauty product sales. In her ideal world she would open her own store where she could display these products. She is characterized as being a woman with many qualities, which help her develop very well in this field. However, to make this dream a reality, she requires capital in the form of a loan to invest in the purchase of her products and to improve some areas in her home where she will set up her business. With your uninterested support Florinda will progress and will not let you down.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

Florinda, enfermera de profesión, tiene 47 años con dos hijos de 17 y 11 años de edad, sufrió bastante con la separación de su esposo; por lo que ahora desempeña la función de padre y madre a la vez. En la actualidad tiene un nuevo compromiso con quien comparte todas sus ideas y ella se siente muy feliz con su apoyo, comprensión y ayuda.Para ella lo más importante es ver a sus hijos contentos y satisfechos, es por eso que ella sobresale en su trabajo y en su negocio. Desde hace mucho tiempo se dedica al arte de la bijoutería, venta de productos de belleza y a la venta de ropas, su mundo ideal es instalar su propia tienda con la exposición de estos productos. Se caracteriza por ser una mujer con muchas cualidades, las cuales le ayudan a desenvolverse muy bien en este campo, sin embargo para hacer realidad este anhelo necesariamente requiere de un capital de dinero para invertirlos en la compra de sus productos y sobre para mejorar los ambientes de su casa para implementar su negocio. Con tu apoyo desinteresado Florinda progresará y no te defraudará.

loans.use: Purchase materials for her bijouterie projects, and clothing and beauty products for her business.

loans.name: Zulmira

texts.es:
Zulmira is 40 years old and dedicates herself to the sale of soft drinks and also to the sale of clothing. Her husband, Sergio Vargas, helps her in the sale of clothing and is who encourages her to move ahead in each one of the projects she sets out to accomplish. Her daughter, who is 19 years old, supports her in the soft drink business. The most important thing for Zulmira is supporting her daughter, who is studying toward a professional career, and her dream is for her to reach that goal without any difficulties. She has always seen herself as an active woman since she has been dedicating herself to the sale of many different products since she was very young. She now feels very happy to own her own business; however, it is necessary for her to finish implementing it now that she has established a strong customer base. With the hope of her business flourishing the way she envisions it, she extends her request and hopes to count with your vital support to materialize each of the goals she has set for herself.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

Zulmira, de 40 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de bebidas heladas y también a la venta de prendas de vestir, su esposo, Sergio Vargas, la ayuda en la venta de las prendas de vestir y es quien la incentiva a seguir adelante con cada uno de los proyectos que se propone, mientras que su hija de 19 años la apoya en su negocio de venta de bebidas heladas. Para ella lo más importante ahora es apoyar a su hija, ya que está estudiando una carrera técnica y lo único que desea es que llegue a culminarla sin que se susciten problemas en su camino.Desde siempre se ha identificado como una mujer activa, por lo que se dedicaba a la venta de distintos productos desde muy joven, ahora se siente muy feliz al tener un negocio propio; sin embargo le es menester implementarlo ya que tiene una importante acogida de sus clientes.A fin de que su negocio surja como ella lo espera, les extiende su solicitud y espera contar con vuestro importante apoyo para concretar cada uno de los planes que se ha propuesto.

loans.use: Implement a small soft drink business.

loans.name: Acela

texts.es:
Acela, along with her loyal companion, Juan, owns a motorcycle and motor cart repair workshop in addition to a small lube center. She tends to the latter business while her husband entirely dedicates his time to the mechanical services. Together they have formed an excellent working partnership, and all of their combined income is used toward offering their four small children, who are in school and wish to prosper in the future by becoming successful professionals, security and well-being.

Acela has a goal of increasing her sales and the services in her business and especially improve the structure of her home, since it is the site of her business and it is her family’s only source of income. Thanks to the daily income generated from her workshop, Acela continues expanding it little by little. However, in order to continue these improvements she needs a sum of money to invest in the business and in the construction of her home. Let’s support the progress of this hard-working mother. Thanks to your vital collaboration, she will accomplish this goal.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

Acela, quién junto a su fiel compañero Juan, tiene una mecánica de motocicletas y motocarros, además de un pequeño lubricentro. Ella se dedica a atender en el segundo pequeño negocio mientras su esposo se dedica por completo al servicio mecánico, juntos han formado una excelente pareja de trabajo y todo el ingreso de ambos es para otorgarles bienestar y seguridad a sus cuatro menores hijos quienes estudian y desean prosperar más adelante convirtiéndose en exitosos profesionales.Ella tiene el propósito de incrementar las ventas y servicios en su negocio y sobre todo mejorar la estructura de su vivienda, ya que es el sitio en el que está ubicado su centro de labores, ya que este es el único ingreso económico para su familia, Gracias a estos ingresos diarios Acela sigue implementando poco a poco su taller; sin embargo ella necesita para mejorar y surgir una suma de dinero para invertirlos en su negocio y la construcción de su vivienda. Apoyemos a esta trabajadora madre a seguir adelante, gracias a tu importante colaboración ella cumplirá su propósito.

loans.use: Purchase construction materials to implement a motorcycle repair workshop and lube center in her home.

loans.name: Melita

texts.es:
Mrs. Melita is 24 years old and shares her humble home with her three-year-old son Bray and her husband Pepe. They are a united and hardworking family. What Melita values most are her family and her trade because thanks to the latter her family can enjoy happiness and wellbeing. She also supports her mother Celia who helps out around the house by caring for her youngest child. Right now, Melita has no problems she can’t take care of and although there is a high demand for what she sells, she always has a plan for improving business. Melita’s goal is to increase her inventory in order to sell products wholesale. To do this she needs an investment to fulfill her plan. Let’s support her how we can. With your help, she can progress.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia, Princeton University Language Project volunteer.

La Señora Melita de 24 años de edad, comparte las instalaciones de su humilde hogar con Bray su hijo de tres años y su esposo, Pepe, con quienes conforma una familia unida y trabajadora. Para Melita lo más importante es su familia y negocio, porque gracias al segundo puede gozar de satisfacción y bienestar junto a su familia, también tiene a su cargo a Celia, su mamá quien la apoya con el cuidado de su menor hijo en casa.Para Melita ahora no existe dificultad alguna que no pueda enfrentar y a pesar de que existe una gran demanda de los productos que ella vende siempre a puesto en marcha un plan de negocios en su bodega para progresar.La meta de Melita es incrementar sus artículos a fin de iniciar su distribución al por mayor, para ello necesita de un capital de inversión que la ayude a cumplir su propósito. Apoyémosla en lo posible, gracias a ti ella progresará.

loans.use: Purchase of staple commodities.

loans.name: Zaida

texts.es:
Mrs Zaida is 51 years old, has 3 children and has a business selling spare parts (for bikes, cars and three wheeler vans).

Her husband, Fernando, is a car mechanic and helps her out because the most important thing for both of them is to give their children enough opportunities so that later on they can become good professionals.

Zaida has always been very active and enterprising, therefore she does not count the hours she works and her business is open 24 hours.

In order to fulfill all the requests from her clients, she needs to improve the facilities of her business. Let’s try to make her request possible so she can materialize all her plans.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Almendares Leistner, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Zaida de 51 años de edad, tiene tres hijos y se dedica a la venta de repuestos, su esposo, Fernando, la apoya ejerciendo su función de mecánico; debido a que para ambos lo más importante es brindarles bienestar a sus tres queridos hijos esperando más adelante sean buenos profesionales. Para Zaida no existen prioridades, ya que ella siempre ha sido muy activa y sobre todo emprendedora, por esta razón no cuenta con un horario de trabajo ya que atiende las 24 horas del día. Y para cumplir con cada una de las peticiones de sus clientes necesita implementar su negocio y acrecentar sus instalaciones, por que cuenta con una clientela muy activa. Posibilitemos su petición para que pronto concrete cada uno de sus planes.

loans.use: To improve the facilities of her shop and buy more spare part products

loans.name: Felipa

texts.es:
Mrs Felipa has 3 children and currently belongs to the community bank “Las Gaviotas”. She manages a three wheeler light delivery van, but also works wrapping tobacco and producing cigarettes for a tobacco company in her city.

Aiming to improve her quality of life and see her children develop and progress, she works hard and with determination.

She requests the loan in order to buy another three wheeler delivery van, that will help her to start a business of spare parts and lubricants for cars and three wheeler vans.

She sincerely hopes you can kindly offer her help.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Almendares Leistner, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Felipa, es madre de tres hijos, en la actualidad pertenece al banco comunal Las Gaviotas.Se dedica a la administración de su motocarro y de manera adicional se dedica también a la envoltura de tabaco y a la fabricación de cigarrillos en una empresa tabaquera de su ciudad. Con el propósito de mejorar su calidad de vida y el de observar el surgimiento de sus hijos se desempeña con ahínco y fortaleza. Desea comprar otro motocarro y mediante los ingresos del mismo llegar a implementar un negocio de lubricantes y repuestos de motos y motocarros, para lo cual requiere de una suma de dinero para invertirlos en la compra de su vehículo trimovil. Ella espera por la ayuda desinteresada de tu noble corazón.

loans.use: To buy a three wheeler light delivery van for a spare parts and lubricants business

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Pedro is 45 years old. He dedicates himself each morning to transporting passengers in his motorcycle-drawn cart and in the afternoons he works in his metal workshop. Right now, there are two vehicles in the workshop; he works on one and his son on the other. His wish is to see his sons become successful professionals. That's why he works hard in order to give them what they need. His companion, Irma, supports him in everything and he is very happy to find himself surround by a family that he values very much. He has plans to acquire another motorcycle cart and improve his workshop. He needs a sum of money which will make his desires possible and create happiness and prosperity for this enterprising and hard-working man. We support this talented and strong father who continues working hard for progress.

Translated by Princeton University Language Project.

Pedro de 45 años de edad, se dedica durante las mañanas al transporte de pasajeros en su motocarro y por las tardes se instala en su taller de estructuras metálicas, en la actualidad cuenta con dos vehículos, en uno de ellos trabaja él y en el otro su hijo.El anhelo que tiene es observar a sus hijos convertidos en unos exitosos profesionales, por esa razón trabaja arduamente a fin de darles lo que ellos necesitan, su compañera, la señora Irma, lo apoya en todo y él se siente muy feliz al saber que se encuentra rodeado de su familia que realmente lo valora mucho.Tiene planes de adquirir otro motocarro y posteriormente mejorar las instalaciones de su taller metálico, para realizar lo que realmente desea le es necesario un suma de dinero el cual posibilitará su propósito y generará alegría y prosperidad a este hombre emprendedor y luchador. Apoyemos a este padre que con talento y esfuerzo sigue trabajando arduamente por progresar.

loans.use: Purchase of car repair parts

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
Anna is 36 years old and is the mother of four children. Right now, she dedicates herself to working in her hair salon, located in her home. Her husband, Wilfredo, is an independent worker and has always supported her in every one of her decisions. For her, the most important thing is to contribute to her four children's progress so that they continue to study and become good men and excellent professionals. Ana studied hairdressing and beauty treatments and now works with great skill. That's why she has acquired the strong base of clients that she now has. She needs a loan to obtain more products for her beauty salon. She hopes for charitable support from your noble and kind heart.

Translated by the Princeton University Language Project.

La Señora Ana a sus 36 años, es madre de cuatro hijos. En la actualidad se dedica a prestar servicios en su peluquería, ubicada en su domicilio; su esposo, Wilfredo, es trabajador independiente y desde siempre la ha apoyado en todas y cada una de sus decisiones. Para ella lo más importante es contribuir con el progreso de sus cuatro hijos que aún estudian a fin de que puedan convertirse en hombres de bien y excelentes profesionales.Ana estudió en un CEO, peluquería y tratamientos de belleza, es por eso que se desempeña con mucha destreza en este rubro y ha conseguido a base de mucho esfuerzo lo que ahora tiene. Requiere de un suma de dinero para adquirir mayor cantidad de productos para la consolidación de su centro de belleza.Ella espera la ayuda desinteresada de tu noble y bondadoso corazón.

loans.use: Purchase of beauty products for her salon

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Martha is 50 years old, and together with her husband, José (sales agent), they dedicate themselves to the wholesale exportation of tobacco. She converts the product (tobacco) into cigarettes and ships them to Aguaytía, Tingo María and Huánuco. Since she has been buying and selling this product, she has improved her economic revenue and especially the structure of her home since it is where she runs her business. As such, she manages a group of people who each work from their homes in the production of these products and pays them a wage according to the number of cigarettes they make. Her efforts to improve and progress have a purpose, which is to purchase a machine that produces cigarettes. It is precisely for that reason that she is requesting a loan that will help her improve and expand her business as she hopes it does. Let’s support Martha, who with talent and effort continues working arduously in order to prosper. Please help her; she will not let you down.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

Martha, de 50 años de edad, junto a su esposo, José(agente vendedor), se dedica a la exportación de tabacos al por mayor. Ella convierte el producto (tabaco) en cigarrillos y los envía a Aguaytía, Tingo María y Huánuco.Mediante la compra y venta de este producto a mejorado sus ingresos económicos y sobre todo la estructura de su vivienda que es el local en el que se desempeñan; así mismo maneja a un grupo de personas que trabaja cada uno en su domicilio en la fabricación de estos productos y les otorga una remuneración deacuerdo a la cantidad de cigarrillos que fabrican. Sus esfuerzos por mejorar y progresar, tienen un propósito, comprar la máquina fabricadora de cigarros y para eso necesariamente requiere de un capital que la ayudará a mejorar e incrementar su negocio como ella lo espera. Apoyemos a Martha que con talento y esfuerzo sigue trabajando arduamente por prosperar, ayudala no te defraudará.

loans.use: Purchase machinery that produces cigarettes.

loans.name: Ana Nieves

texts.es:
Ana belongs to the Las Activas community bank in the Peruvian "departamento" of Ucayali. She's 37 years old and a single mother of 4 children. Ana's income doesn't cover her family's expenses so she decided, with her first loan from Manuela Ramos of S/.300 (300 Peruvian soles or about US$100), to set up a small general store. She now depends on the store and her sales of retail groceries. The business is lcoated in her house so she needn't leave her children by themselves. She gets up very early to make breakfast before then tending to the store.

With a recently-granted loan from Manuela Ramos of S/.1,800 (about US$603), to be repaid in 5 months, she will supply the store with 4 cases of milk; 4 sacks of rice; 2 sacks of sugar; 3 packages of pasta; 3 cases of large-sized cooking oil; 2 cases of small-sized cooking oil; 2 cases of tuna; 1 case of soap;1 packet of detergent; 2 boxes of disposable diapers; and other inventory.

Ana is pleased to watch her business prosper because it's been a very important goal for her.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Ana pertenece al Banco Comunal las Activas, vive en el Asentamiento Humano Santa Rosa - Jr. San Pedro Mz. C Lt. 32, del distrito Calleria, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 37 años de edad y es madre soltera, tiene 4 hijos y el ingreso que tiene no alcanza para los gastos de la casa, es así que Ana, con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300.00 (US$100.00) decide poner una pequeña bodega. para la venta de abarrotes al por menor. En la actualidad cuenta con su pequeña bodega donde vende abarrotes al por menor. El negocio está ubicado en su propia casa, lo que le permite atender a sus hijos sin tener que ausentarse. Se levanta muy temprano para hacer el desayuno y después de dedica a la bodega.

Con el reciente préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 1,800, (US$ 603.00 aprox.), el cual será pagado en 5 meses, implementará su negocio con 04 cajas de leche, 04 sacos de arroz, 02 sacos de azúcar, 03 paquetes de fideos, 03 cajas de aceite grande, 02 cajas de aceite chico, 02 cajas de atunes, 01 caja de jabón, 1 paquete de detergente, 02 megas de pampers, 01 caja de panteón y 12 cubetas de huevo.

Ana está muy contenta al ver que su negocio prospera, ya que es un logro muy importante para ella.

loans.use: Buy general merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.es:
Lilia belongs to the Las Activas community bank. She lives in the Peruvian "departamento" of Ucayali. She's 49 years old and the mother of 8 children. Her husband is a teamster (cargo handler) but his earnings don't cover the family's expenses so Lilia, with her first loan from Manuela Ramos of S/.300 (300 Peruvian soles or about US$100) decided to set up a small sewing business. Her business is in her house. She gets up every morning at 6 to go to the market and make breakfast for her children and spends the afternoons on sewing jobs.

With a recently-granted loan from Manuela Ramos of S/.1,000 (about US$335), to be repaid in 5 months, she will supply her workroom with 50 meters of cloth, a half-dozen threads, 3 packets of needles, 3 rolls of elastic, a supply of lace and oil to take care of her sewing machine.

Lilia is pleased to see her business prosper because it's been a very important goal for her. Thanks to the business, she's improved her family's well-being.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Lilia pertenece al Banco Comunal las Activas, vive en Jr. Señor de los Milagros Nº 460, del distrito Calleria, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 49 años de edad y es madre de 8 hijos, su esposo es estibador (operario de carga), pero el ingreso que tiene no alcanza para los gastos en su hogar, es así que Lilia, con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300.00 (US$100.00) decide poner un pequeño taller de costura. Su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su propia casa, se levanta a las 6 de la mañana para ir al mercado y preparar el desayuno a sus hijos, y por las tardes se dedica a la costura.

Con el reciente préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 1.000, (US$ 335.00 aprox.), el cual será pagado en 5 meses, implementará su taller con 50 metros de telas, media docena de hilos, 3 paquetes de agujas, 3 conos de elásticos, blondas, y aceite para el mantenimiento de la maquina de coser.

Lilia está muy contenta al ver que su negocio prospera, ya que es un logro muy importante para ella, gracias a ello ha alcanzado el bienestar de su familia.

loans.use: Buy wholesale supplies for tailoring business.

loans.name: Marianella

texts.es:
Marianela is 25 years old and is the owner of a motorcycle-drawn cart and the mother of two children: Lesley (1 year) and Shirley (7 years) who is in the second grade of elementary school. Her husband drives the motorcycle cart, the income from which Marianela uses for daily expenses and for the wellbeing of her children. She, like all mothers, hopes her children will become professionals some day. This noble mother needs to improve her motorcycle cart, which is the only means of support for her home, and needs capital to acquire vehicle parts and open a small bodega soon. With your support we will succeed in helping this young mother reach her goal soon and give a breath of hope to her family.

Translated by Princeton University Language Project.

Marianela, de 25 años de edad, es propietaria de un motocarro y madre de dos niños Lesly de 01 añito y Shirley de 7 años, quien cursa el segundo grado de educación primaria, su esposo conduce el motocarro y aporta con su desempeño diario 15 nuevos soles, los cuales utiliza, Marianela, para sus gastos diarios y sobre todo para el bienestar de sus hijos; ella como toda madre espera que sus hijos sean profesionales algún día.Esta noble madre tiene la seria necesidad de mejorar su motocarro, ya que es la única herramienta de trabajo que tiene para el sustento de su hogar, y necesita un capital que le ayudará a adquirir los repuestos que necesita su vehículo de transporte a fin de instalar una pequeña bodega en corto tiempo. Con tu apoyo lograremos que esta joven madre cumpla su propósito en muy corto tiempo y así dar un aliento de esperanza a su familia.

loans.use: Purchase of parts for her motorcycle-drawn cart

loans.name: Verónica

texts.es:
Verónica has been working raising palmetto trees for some time. She currently has 20 hectars of sown palmettos. She embarked on this venture with one goal: to collaborate in the culmination of her son Richard's university career. Together with her husband, Luis, she decided to extend the growing season of this product since raising palmettos brings her excellent benefits. Since palms require extremely detailed care, the harvest of the product is carried out weekly. To improve the transfer of the product to market she needs a vehicle. With your kind support Verónica will be able to make her plans reality in a short time.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Verónica, se dedica al cultivo de palmitos desde hace mucho tiempo y actualmente cuenta con veinte hectáreas de palmitos sembrados. Ella se encaminó en este proyecto con una sola meta de colaborar con la culminación de la carrera universitaria de su hijo Ricardo; en compañía de su esposo, Luis, decidió incrementar la siembra de este producto ya que les brinda muchos beneficios; debido a que estas necesitan de un cuidado extremo, la cosecha de este productos se produce de manera semanal y con el propósito de mejorar su traslado requiere de una movilidad.Con tu gentil apoyo la señora Verónica podrá concretar su propósito en corto tiempo.

loans.use: Purchase of a vehicle to transport the fruit she produces (hearts of palm).

loans.name: Llesica

texts.es:
Llesica belongs to the Teresa Ramos community bank. She lives in the Peruvian "departamento" of Ucayali. She's 29 years old and the mother of 3 young children. Her husband is a mechanic, but his income doesn't cover all of the family's expenses so Llesica, with her first loan from Manuela Ramos of S/.300 (300 Peruvian soles or about US$100) decided to set up a poultry business. Llesica tends to her business with great care and dedication. She gets up at 5 in the morning to feed her chickens before then making breakfast for her children.

With a recently-granted loan from Manuela Ramos of S/.1,400 (about US$468), to be repaid in 4 months, she will buy 50 chickens and bulk supplies (feed, vitamins, etc.) to raise them for market; shhe will invest S/.400 of the loan in the construction of a chicken coop. She will also help her husband by buying some bulk supplies--oil, brake fluid, etc.--that he will use for his business.

Llesica is very please that her chickens are growing and will soon be ready for sale at different wholesale and retail markets in the city of Pucalipa. Thanks to the business, Llesica has high hopes of making a little money so that she can help her young children get a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Llesica pertenece al Banco Comunal “Teresa Ramos”, vive en el Jr. 3 de Octubre 539, del distrito de Yarina Cocha del departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 29 años y es madre de 3 hijos que son menores de edad. Está casada, su esposo es mecánico, pero el ingreso que tiene no alcanza para los gastos de la casa, es así que Llesica, con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300.00 (US$ 100.00) decide poner un galpón de pollos en su misma casa. La señora Llesica atiende su negocio con mucho esmero y dedicación. Se levantan a las 5.00 de la mañana para darles de comer a sus pollitos, y luego prepara el desayuno de sus pequeños hijitos.

Con el reciente préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 1,400 (US$ 468.00 aprox.), el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará 50 pollos y alimento para mejorar su crianza (1 saco de engorde, ½ saco de inicio, 1 saco de crecimiento, dos frascos de vitaminas de pollo, 5 sobres de vitaminas), también invertirá S/. 400.00 en la construcción de un galpón. Por otro lado, ayudará a su esposo a mejorar su negocio con la compra de 3 baldes de aceite, 1 galón de liquido de freno, 1 galón de hidrolina y 2 paquetes de cera.

Llesica está muy contenta porque los pollitos de su galpón están creciendo y pronto estarán listas para la venta al por mayor y al por menor en los diferentes mercados de la ciudad de Pucallpa y yarinacocha. Gracias a ello, Llesica tiene mayores ganas de salir adelante en su negocio, al saber que podrá tener un poco de dinero producto de su esfuerzo para apoyar en los estudios a sus menores hijos, quienes necesitan de su total apoyo.

loans.use: Buy chickens and feed for poultry business.

loans.name: Silveria

texts.es:
Silveria, 59 years old, is a hard-working and cheerful mother. Since she formed her family with Francisco, her loyal husband, she has always strived to move ahead, working in a diverse array of activities looking to obtain a better future along with her three minor children. This hard-working family had hoped to open a large wholesale store distributing wool, and to realize this plan, they had some money saved up. Unfortunately, they were victims of theft by unscrupulous individuals, leaving the entire family in a very bad economic state.

This situation, however, did not cause Silveria to give up. With the strength and commitment that are characteristic of her, she decided to open a small grocery store which she now intends to expand and increase the variety of its products. To make this happen, she is requesting a loan which she plans to repay in 6 months. Let’s support the progress of this entrepreneurial family.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Silveria, es una laboriosa y alegre madre D. 51 años D. edad, desD. que formó su familia junto a Francisco, su fiel esposo, siempre luchó por salir adelante, desempeñándose en diversas actividades para buscar obtener un mejor porvenir junto a sus tres hijos menores.Esta trabajadora familia pretendía poner una gran tienda D. distribución D. lana al por mayor y para concretar sus planes tenían ahorrado un dinerito, pero desafortunadamente sufrió un robo por inescrupulosas personas, dejando a toda su familia en una situación económica muy mala.Sin embargo esta situación no fue motivo para que doña Silveria se rindiera, con la fuerza y empeño que la caracteriza decidió abrir su bodeguita D. abarrotes, negocio que pretenD. ampliar y aumentar la variedad D. sus productos, para concretar sus planes solicita un préstamo a fin D. reembolsarles en un lapso D. seis meses.Apoyemos a esta emprendedora familia a progresar.

loans.use: Purchase a larger quantity and wider variety of provisions.

loans.name: Timotea

texts.es:
Timotea comes from a humble family. Several years ago, she decided to leave her home town, Chupa, in search of a better future. Since then, she has sold red meat as a traveling vendor in the Santa Bárbara market in the city of Juliaca. In addition to this work, she raises pigs, and she obtains extra income from their sale. While she is doing this work, her enterprising husband works as a mechanic. Both are looking to save up and to construct the house that they want so much to offer well-being and security to their five beloved children. Timotea's wish is to have a larger quantity of money to use as investment capital with the aim of selling a larger quantity of pigs, a business which has a lot of demand in this season. She is turning to your support and requesting a loan. Timotea is anxiously awaiting your response.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Timotea, proviene de una humilde familia, hace algunos años decidió salir de su pueblo natal, Chupa, en busca de un mejor porvenir, desde entonces se dedica a la venta de carnes rojas en forma ambulatoria en el mercado Santa Bárbara de la ciudad de Juliaca, adicionalmente a este trabajo se dedica a la crianza de Cerdos, de los cuales obtiene ingresos económicos extras luego de su comercialización.Mientras ella se dedica a esta labor, su emprendedor esposo trabaja como mecánico y entre ambos buscan ahorrar y construir su tan anhelada casita para ofrecerles bienestar y seguridad a sus cinco queridos hijos.El deseo de Timotea es contar con mayor cantidad de dinero para utilizarlos como capital de inversión a fin de comercializar mayor cantidad de cerditos, negocio que por estas temporadas tendrá mayor demanda. Recurre a tu apoyo y solicita un préstamo. En estos momentos Timotea espera ansiosa tu respuesta.

loans.use: Purchase of a larger quantity of pigs.

loans.name: Azucenas Group

texts.es:
The Azucenas CommUnity (CommUnity is a term used by Friendship Bridge to refer to the Communal Banks) is composed of a group of women who surprise the inspectors with their organization and punctuality. Members of Azucenas always arrive to repayment and disbursement meetings on time, then proceed to sit down orderly and wait for the credit agent to assign their turn to speak, when everyting is in place. This organization is also evident in the financial aspect. These women have been working, collaborating and sharing for approximately seven years. The recipe for this Community to stay together for so long lays in the combination of different ingredients these women have combined, such as promptness of repayment, honesty, solidarity and trust.

Almost all the members of this CommUnity have been and are weavers. From a young age, they learned the backstrap loom weaving technique, producing naturally colored fabrics. They have learned to color threads using natural dyes, which they get from the mountains. They use the trunk of the banana tree to fix colors and the trunk of avocado, leaves from different bushes, medicinal plants and food ingredients to obtain the dyes. They learned these techniques, which have been passed on for generations in San Juan la Laguna, from their mothers and grandmothers.

They will invest the credit in buying thread wholesale, in order to decrease production costs. One of the women is a painter and she’ll use the loan to buy oil paint. María C. Gonzales mentioned that her son is sick and she’ll have to make a great effort and invest half of the loan in her business and use the other half to buy medicines for her son.

Members of Azucena have several dreams. Marilú Jacinta C. pointed out that she wants to send her son, recently graduated from high-school, to college. For that she needs her business to keep prospering as it has been recently. Concepción M. wants another loan because she would like her business to consolidate to the point where she’s able to buy a small lot of land for her son.

These women constitute an example for all the indigenous women in the region. Many years ago, they decided to become financially independent and support their respective husbands with extra money to cover household expenses.

Thanks to their effort they are reaching their goals, sending their children to school and providing them with a permanent roof and sufficient food, in order for them to advance. The Azucenas are a typical example of Guatemalan indigenous women, who set the well-being of their families above their own. Nonetheless, if their businesses grow and prosper in the way they have projected, that situation doesn’t have to continue, and all will be able to enjoy a good life. Help them!

One of the women was not able to be in the picture, due to health issues.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

La ComUnidad Azucenas (ComUnidad es un término que utiliza Friendship Bridge para llamar a los Bancos comunales) está conformado por un grupo de señoras que sorprenden a los veedores por su organización y puntualidad. Las Azucenas siempre llegan a las reuniones de repago y desembolso a la hora exacta, luego prosiguen a sentarse en orden y esperan a que la agente de crédito les de la palabra inicial una vez que todo está en orden. Esta organización también se ve en el aspecto financiero. Estas señoras han venido trabajando, colaborando y compartiendo juntas desde hace aproximadamente 7 años. La receta para que esta ComUnidad haya permanecido junta por tanto tiempo es que esta señoras han combinado distintos ingredientes como: la puntualidad del repago, la honestidad, la solidaridad y la confianza.

Casi todas de las integrantes de esta ComUnidad han sido y son tejedoras. Desde pequeñas ellas aprendieron a tejer con la técnica de telar de cintura, telas teñidas con tintes naturales. Además, ellas aprendieron a teñir los hilos con tintes naturales. Estos tintes naturales las señoras los traen de las montañas. Ellas utilizan el tronco del banano como fijador de colores, el tronco del aguacate, hojas de arbustos, plantas medicinales e ingredientes de comida para sacar los tintes. Las técnicas que ellas utilizan las aprendieron de sus madres y abuelas. Son tradiciones que han sido aprendidas por generaciones en San Juan la Laguna.

Estas señoras van a invertir su crédito en comprar hilo al por mayor para reducir sus costos de producción. Una de las señoras es pintora. Ella va a utilizar el préstamo para comprar pintura óleo. María C. Gonzales comentó que su hijo estaba enfermo. Ella va a hacer malabares para invertir la mitad de su crédito en su negocio y la otra mitad en comprar medicinas para su hijo.

Las integrantes de las Azucenas tienen varios sueños. Marilú Jacinta C. comentó que ella quiere mandar a su hijo recién graduado del colegio a la universidad. Lo único que necesita es que su negocio siga prosperando de la misma manera como ha venido sucediendo. Concepción M. quiere otro préstamo porque quiere que su negocio se consolide al punto donde ella pueda ganar lo suficiente para poder comprar un terrenito para su hijo.

Estas señoras son un ejemplo para todas las mujeres indígenas de la región. Muchos años atrás ellas decidieron independizarse económicamente y apoyar a sus respectivos maridos con dinero extra para cubrir los gastos de la casa.

Gracias a su esfuerzo ellas están cumpliendo sus objetivos, mandar a sus hijos a la escuela y proveerles un techo permanente y suficiente comida para que puedan salir adelante. Las Azucenas son un típico ejemplo de la mujer indígena Guatemalteca, ellas ponen el bienestar de su familia por encima del de ellas. Sin embargo, si sus negocio crecen y prosperan de la manera como ellas han proyectado, esa situación no va a tener que suceder, ya que todos van a poder disfrutar de una buena vida. Ayúdenlas a salir adelante!

Una de las señoras no pudo estar presente en la fotografía por razones de salud.

loans.use: Purchase of thread for the production of huipiles (Mayan women blouses).

loans.name: Xocomil Group

texts.es:
ComUnidad Xocomil (ComUnidad is a term that Friendship Bridge uses to name Communal Banks) is formed by a group of happy, entrepreneurial, united and pioneering women. This ComUnidad is one of the oldest in Friendship Bridge.

This group of women are requesting their 16th loan with the institution, despite the adversities that are presented to indigenous women in the rural areas of Guatemala. They have maintained themselves united for approximately 7 years, consolidating an unequaled friendship based on honesty and work ethic. The women of Xocomil are an example to Guatemalan society because they were one of the pioneers when they first applied for a loan almost a decade ago – a situation that had never occurred before.

Many of these women worked as housekeepers in wealthy homes in the capital city or in the homes of their relatives. Others grew up as weavers, lending their services to more developed businesses as cheap labor. These artisans also worked weaving their own products per individual requests, but in a very small scale. They earned enough to cover their living expenses, however, since they united with Friendship Bridge, their businesses have prospered and they have turned into successful businesswomen.

In ComUnidad Xocomil, one can find women that work in different economic sectors. For example, six of them weave beautiful huipiles (traditional indigenous Guatemalan dress); three of them work buying and selling traditional clothes such as skirts, aprons, sashes and blouses; three others sell breakfasts, lunches and dinners in the market and for house delivery; while another three cut up chickens and pigs and sell them in the market. One of them makes and sells tortillas in her own locale, while two others have a bakery.

The women will invest the loan in the purchase of thread for the production of huipiles and the purchase of chickens to quarter and sell in the market, while other women will buy blouses and aprons for their respective trade. The women that have a bakery will buy flour and utensils for the production of bread.

These women have been examples of the positive impact that microfinancing institutions have on the lives of women. Thanks to Friendship Bridge, they are full of hopes and dreams. Many of them aspire to purchase a plot of land to construct a house for their children or expand their small homes. They also hope that their children graduate from high school so that they do not have to experience what these women lived, an illiteracy that deprived them of many rights and advantages. The dreams of these women are consolidated with each loan and investment that they bring to their businesses and families. Help them maintain this hope.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

La ComUnidad Xocomil (ComUnidad es un término que utiliza Friendship Bridge para nombrar a los Bancos Comunales) está conformada por un grupo de mujeres alegres, emprendedoras, unidas y pioneras. Esta ComUnidad es una de las más antiguas en Friendship Bridge.

Este grupo de señoras están solicitando su 16to préstamo con la institución, a pesar de las adversidades que se les presenta a mujeres indígenas en las áreas rurales de Guatemala. Ellas se han mantenido unidas por aproximadamente 7 años consolidando una amistad inigualable que está basada en honestidad y trabajo. Las mujeres del Xocomil son un ejemplo a la sociedad Guatemalteca porque ellas fueron una de las pioneras al solicitar su crédito hace casi una década. Una situación que antes no sucedía

Muchas de estas señoras trabajaron como empleadas domésticas en casas de gente adinerada en la capital o en casa de sus parientes. Otras crecieron como tejedoras prestando sus servicios a empresarios más desarrollados como mano de obra barata. También, las estas artesanas trabajaban tejiendo sus propios tejidos a pedidos individuales, pero en muy pequeña escala. Ellas ganaban lo suficiente para cubrir sus gastos de vida. Sin embargo, desde que se unieron a Friendship Bridge sus negocios han prosperado y se han vuelto en empresarias exitosas.

En la Comunidad Xocomil se puede encontrar a señoras que trabajan en distintas áreas económicas. Por ejemplo, seis de ellas son tejedoras de hermosos huipiles (trajes tradicionales indígenas Guatemaltecos); tres trabajan en la compra y venta de ropa tradicional como faldas, delantales, fajas y blusas; tres señoras venden desayunos, almuerzos y cenas en el mercado y a domicilio; mientras que otras tres destazan pollos y cerdos y los venden en el mercado; una de ellas prepara y vende tortillas en su propio local y dos señoras tienen una panadería.

El crédito va a ser invertido por las señoras en la compra de hilo para la producción de huipiles, compra de pollos para destazarlos y venderlos en el mercado, otras señoras van a usar el crédito para comprar blusas y delantales para su respectiva venta. Las señoras que tienen una panadería van a comprar harina y utensilios para la producción de pan.

Estas señoras han sido ejemplos del impacto positivo que tiene las microfinanzas en la vida de las mujeres. Ellas, gracias a Friendhsip Bridge, están llenas de esperanzas y sueños. Muchas de ellas aspiran a comprarse un terreno para construir una casa para sus hijos o para ampliar sus pequeñas casas. También aspiran a que sus hijos se gradúen del colegio para que así ellos no tengan que pasar por lo que ellas vivieron, un analfabetismo que las privó de muchos derechos y ventajas. Los sueños de estas señoras se consolida con cada préstamo e inversión que ellas hacen en su negocio y su familias, ayúdenlas a mantener esa esperanza.

loans.use: Purchase thread for the creation of traditional dresses; chickens and pigs to sell in the market; ingredients for the preparation of meals; blouses and aprons for the sale of clothing; and flour and utensils for a bakery.

loans.name: Juraboi

texts.en: Juraboi B. lives in Kostakoz; he is married and has 4 children. His first application to Microinvest was in 2006, but the loan sum is permanently increased based on his income increase. Juraboi B. is a very experienced businessman with about 40 years experience in this field; he also has a partner and a staff. Currently he requires a loan in the sum of 2500 STJ for livestock and business modernization.

loans.use: Business modernization

loans.name: Rustam

texts.en: Rustam Usmanov lives in Kastakoz; he is married and has children. He appealed to Microinvest three times and every time the loan sum was increased. He recommended himself as a serious and loyal client. He has about 10 years of experience in business, and his wife participates closely in the business. He also works as the inspector of Raygaz. Now he requires a new loan of 2000 STJ for livestock support and development.

loans.use: Business support and expansion

loans.name: Tolibjon

texts.en: Tolibjon T. lives in Khujand; he is married and has 3 children. He is an experienced businessman, and the main sphere of his activity is livestock. He recommends himself as an honest and serious client. Having a lot of interesting and real ideas, now he requires a loan for business support and modernization, and to have the opportunity to realize the ideas in life.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Sarvar

texts.en: Sarvar K. lives in Khujand; she is married and has 6 children. Based on the long time she has been in business, she recommends herself as a serious and executive person. She is very polite and honest with her clients, so they wish to co-operate tightly with her. Sarvar K. wants to realize new business ideas, and so now she requires a loan for business support and modernization.

loans.use: Business support

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Business support

loans.name: Mirvary

texts.en: Mirvary H. (her daughter is pictured) is a widow. She was born in 1972. Mirvary with her daughter live in Salyan region, in the village of Yenikand. She started a farming business 15 years ago. Now she needs a loan of $1200 to buy a plot of land for improving her business.

loans.use: Buy a plot of land

loans.name: Jahan

texts.en: M y name is Jahan A.. I am married and a mother of four children. I live with my family in the big city of Lahore, Pakistan. We have a family business of making plastic brushes that are used in the cleaning of toilets. We now plan to produce a large quantity of brushes in order to increase our income, therefore, we require a loan to buy the necessary raw materials such as wooden sticks, wire, and artificial brush hairs. I have been a borrower in my lending group for the past one year and have always repaid my loans on time. My future plan is to save the extra profits from this business to purchase a big house for my family.

loans.use: Expand existing business

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Asasah, a partner of Save the Children - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Kaneez

texts.en: My name is Kaneez B.. I am married and a mother of two children. I live with my family in Lahore, a big metropolis. I am a textile designer and I embroider clothes, whereas my husband is a livestock dealer. My son is very enterprising and he operates a used clothing business. He now wants to operate at a bit bigger scale and buy these used clothes in bulk. For this purpose we require a loan of $350.

loans.use: Expand used clothing business

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Asasah, a partner of Save the Children - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Kamil

texts.en:
Kamil was born in 1961. He is single and lives in Khachmaz town. He has been repairing houses for 10 years. 
He goes to the houses of his clients and repairs their houses. Now he needs a loan of $725 to buy necessary materials for repairing the houses to increase his income.

loans.use: Buy necessary materials for repairing the houses

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en: I am Nasreen A. from Lahore, a big and busy metropolis. I am married with four children. All of my children attend school except one boy who is an apprentice at a tailor’s shop. I stitch clothes on order from my neighborhood clients. I feel the need for an extra income, as it very hard to make both ends meet. I therefore have decided to expand my stitching business. For this purpose, I need to buy an additional stitching machine and hire a helper. Please lend me $350.

loans.use: Expand stitching business

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Asasah, a partner of Save the Children - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Arzuman

texts.en: Arzuman (his son is pictured) is 38 years old and lives in Salyan region, in the Yenikand village. He has 3 children. Ten years ago he started a farming business. Now he needs a loan of $1200 to buy fertilizer and pesticides for improving his business.

loans.use: Buy fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Sarwar

texts.en: I am a widow and a mother of nine children, five girls and four boys. I make traditional bracelets that the brides wear on their weddings. I have been making these bracelets for last twenty five years and now two of my sons also assist me in this business. I am requesting a loan of $350 so that I can expand my current business. With this loan I will buy the required raw materials in bulk. I hope that with this business expansion we will be able to earn higher profits this wedding season that is just around the corner.

loans.use: Expand bracelets business

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Asasah, a partner of Save the Children - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Abiba

texts.en: Abiba Seidu is divorced and has one child age 12.  She is a trader who deals in provisions and food supplies. She  She pays her child’s school fees from the profit from her sales. She is working very hard. In order to improve her living condition, she wants to expand her business to maximize her profit.  She is asking for $1,200 to buy more bags of rice, cooking oil, mineral water, provisions, and crates of soft drinks to stock her store.

loans.use: To buy more bags of rice, cooking oil, mineral water, provisions, and crates of soft drinks for her store.

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.en: Benjamin Kwabena G. is an unmarried woodworker with no children.  He wants to shift from his traditional method of production to a mechanical method. He is in a process of acquiring a wood cutting machine. Part payment has been made but the seller will not release the machine to him until he pays the full cost of the machine.  He is asking for $1,200 to buy the wood cutting machine, sprayers, modern tools and other equipment to enable him meet the demand of his customers.

loans.use: To buy a wood cutting machine, sprayers, modern tools and other equipment.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen A. is married with a 5 month old baby.  His wife is a seamstress who supports the family in her small way. He is a well known electrician/trader at Moree, where he lives. He also receives orders from electrical contractors for electrical supplies. There has been a tremendous increase in demand for electrical parts from his customers.  He is asking for $1,200 to increase his working capital to buy more electrical parts to meet the increasing demand of his customers.

loans.use: To increase his working capital to buy more electrical parts to meet the increasing demand of his customers.

loans.name: Hashmat

texts.en: I would like to borrow $350 to help my husband diversify his business. He started keeping video games in his small grocery store last year and we made enough profit that it allowed me to save a dollar a day. We would like to keep expanding our business to stock up on more videos and also add dairy products to our grocery store. I have seven children one of whom has completed tenth grade and our house is rented. I would like to increase our income enough to see at least one or both of these things change.

loans.use: Expand grocery store

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Asasah, a partner of Save the Children - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Jamilah

texts.en: Jamilah S. is married to a Tanker driver. She has three children ages 18, 10 and 8. Jamilah is supporting with the family finances by owning a mini super market. She also does distribution as people come and buy from her and also sell to other customers. She also sells shoes and cosmetics.  Jamilah is not able to buy the provisions in large quantities because of she does not have enough working capital.  She is asking for $1,200 as additional capital to buy more provisions, bags, shoes and clothing for her store.

loans.use: As additional capital to buy more provisions, bags, shoes and clothing for her store.

loans.name: Nusrat

texts.en: I moved to Vehari, a small town near a fairly large and industrial city of Faisalabad, after I got married 10 years ago. I have four small children all of whom are in school except the youngest one who will hopefully start next year. I need $200 to purchase a Rickshaw (local three-wheeled vehicle) so that I can drive around the city. There isn’t much public transport available in the city so it would be easy for me to obtain business.

loans.use: Purchase rickshaw

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Asasah, a partner of Save the Children - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Rehmat

texts.en: I live in Vehari, a small town about 350 km from Lahore, the second largest city of Pakistan, but Vehari is quite accessible by road. I have been living here for the past 12 years in a room and have four children. I want a loan for myself of $200 to purchase a new sewing machine. I make clothes for women in the city and make about three outfits per day and generate an income of over $4 per day. With an increased income I can help make the standard of living of my family better.

loans.use: Buy a new sewing machine

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Asasah, a partner of Save the Children - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en: Daniel A. is married with no children. His wife is a seamstress who is working very hard to support family finances.  Daniel is a Trader. He deals in building materials, supplying paint and other building materials.  Daniel wants to sell PVC pipes because he receives a lot of orders from his customers but needs needs additional capital.  He is asking for a loan of US $1,200 to buy more nails, PVC pipes, iron sheets, wheel barrows, mosquito net, and paint which are highly demanded by his customers.

loans.use: To buy more nails, PVC pipes, iron sheets, wheel barrows, mosquito net, and paint which are highly demanded by his customers.

loans.name: Clement

texts.en: Clement Mensah is married with an 8 month old baby. His wife is a seamstress and she is working very hard to support her husband financially. Clement is a trader who deals in building tools and materials. His business is doing very well and he wants additional capital to buy more materials for his store.  He is asking for $1,200 to buy more nails, pick-axes, shovels, electrical appliances, electrical frames, and paint to meet customer demand.

loans.use: To buy more nails, pick-axes, shovels, electrical appliances, electrical frames, and paint to meet customer demand.

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en: I am the mother of two and live in the small town of Vehari in Pakistan. My family and I live in a small brick and mud house which we rent. My husband has been running a small juice and fizzy drinks stall in our town for the past couple of years. It gets really hot here in Vehari so sales are pretty good. We need a loan of $350 to purchase stock, including juice cartons and fizzy drinks. We get good rates if we buy in bulk. We took a loan last year and made a good profit on it.  I also chip in to generate some income for my family and sew women’s clothes when I am free from household chores.

loans.use: Purchase stock of juice cartons and fizzy drinks

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Asasah, a partner of Save the Children - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en: My husband runs a dry cleaning service. Some of his machines are old and he wants to buy new ones and for this, he needs a loan of $250. He has been in this business for a couple of years now and our service has been expanding lately and we are getting more clients so the machines would be very helpful. We have four children and thankfully all of them are in school. I hope that they will continue their education with our profits. We live in Vehari, a small town located in Pakistan’s densely populated province of Punjab.

loans.use: Buy new dry cleaning machines

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Asasah, a partner of Save the Children - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther A. is married with three children. Her husband is also a trader. Esther is helping her husband with the family finances. Esther is a mobile trader.  She carries what she sells on her head and performs door to door sales. However, her door to door business is breaking her down. She wants to build a store and settle down.  She is asking for $1,200 to buy cement, iron rod, paints, and other building materials for the store she wants to build.
