loans.use: To buy cement, iron rod, paints, and other building materials for the store she wants to build.

loans.name: Ebo

texts.en: Ebo Dadzi is a taxi driver and owner. He is married and has a child aged 3year 6months. His wife is a seamstress and she is supporting with the family finances. His taxi car has broken down. He is considering buying a new car which is more economical than repairing the old one. He is asking for a loan $1,200 which would be added to his savings to buy a new taxi so that he can get himself back into business.

loans.use: To buy a new taxi.

loans.name: Ben

texts.en:
Ben D. is a hardware dealer who deals in all kinds of building materials. He is married with three children. The wife is also a trader. Mr. D. works very hard and has lots of customers. The shop is located at a very good place. He supplies building contractors with all kinds of building materials. 

One major challenge that Ben faces is that orders from his customers keep on increasing but his capital has not.   So it has become difficult to meet rising customer demand.  He is therefore asking for a loan of US $ 1,200 dollars to buy more door locks, paints, brushes, plywood, water closet seaters, and roofing sheets to supply to his contractors.

loans.use: To buy more door locks, paints, brushes, plywood’s, water closet seaters, and roofing sheets to supply to his contractors.

loans.name: Kofi Isaiah

texts.en:
Kofi Isaiah D. works as an electrician. He is married with four children. Apart from his electrician work, he also has a hardware store. He supplies plywoods, door locks, turpentine, and all types of paints to his customers most of whom are contractors. 

Isaiah works very hard. The wife is also a trader who works at his hardware store.  Due to the high cost of plywood, door locks and paints, his capital has become so low that he is not able to meet the demands of individual customers, let alone, the demand of contractors who buy from him in large quantities.  He is therefore asking for a loan of US $ 1,200 to increase his inventory of more plywood, door locks, paints, turpentine and other building materials to supply his customers.

loans.use: To stock his store with more plywood, door locks, paints, turpentine and other building materials.

loans.name: Walter

texts.en:
Walter D. is a trader who deals in foam mattresses from Ash Foam Ghana limited. He sells ash foam products to institutions and individuals. He is a hardworking man. He is married with one child. The wife is also a trader.
One major challenge that Walter  faces is that prices of the mattresses have been going up.  He is therefore asking for a loan of US $ 1,200 dollars to buy the mattresses in bulk from the factory so that he can also meet customer demand.

loans.use: To buy the mattresses in bulk from the factory.

loans.name: Justina

texts.en: Justina A. is a trader who deals in fishing net. She is married with three children. Her husband is also a trader. Justina works very hard. She receives her supply from a company in Accra.  The demand for nets and threads from Justina is great but her capital is limited.  She is asking for a loan of US $ 1,200 to enable her buy more fishing nets and more thread for repairing fishing nets to meet customer demand.

loans.use: To buy more fishing nets and more thread for repairing fishing nets

loans.name: Sevindj

texts.en: Sevindj was born in 1983. She is single and lives in Khachmaz region, in the village of Hulovlu. She has sold mincing machines, electric irons, perfumery, etc. for 6 years at retail. Now she needs a loan of $950 to buy goods for improving her business.

loans.use: Buy goods

loans.name: Gulnara

texts.en: Gulnara (her sister is pictured) is a mother of one child. She is 49 years old and lives in Khachmaz town. She has run this business for 4 years. Now she needs a loan of  $850 to buy clothes for improving her business.

loans.use: To buy clothes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Continue investing in cosmetics and clothing

loans.name: Please

texts.es: Client posted twice

loans.use: Comprar mas mercaderia y atender mas clientes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy more products and diversify the product line

loans.name: Fikrat

texts.en: Fikrat (his brother is pictured) is a married man who lives in Salyan region, in the village of Khaladj.This 30-year-old man has been raising cattle for 8 years. Now he needs a loan of $1200 to buy a baling presses for improving his business.

loans.use: To buy baling presses

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Continue improving her product offerings and inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy more products for his store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Invest on a greater variety of products including Christmas items

loans.name: Shadoglan

texts.en: Shadoglan (his son is pictured) was born in 1950. He is married and has 4 children. M.'s family lives in Salyan region, in the village of Yenikand. 10 years ago he decided to start the farming business to support his family. Now he needs a loan of $1200 to buy fertilizer  and pesticides.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer  and pesticides

loans.name: Asiman

texts.en: This 42-year-old man lives in Salyan region, Khaladj village. He is married and has a child. This man has run a farming business for 7 years. Now he needs a loan of $1200 to buy fertilizer and pesticides for improving his business.

loans.use: He would like to purchase fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Santos

texts.es:
Santos lives on Rodolfo Palenque Avenue in the Villa Dolores area of the city of El Alto. He lives together with his wife, who works as a shopkeeper. He has two sons; 16 and 14 years old.

The loan will be used to purchase spare parts for his vehicle. He works as a waiter in a restaurant at the airport of the city. This is his second loan with IMPRO. His evaluation showed that he is eligible to request the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Kim Baker, Kiva volunteer.

Santos vive en la Avenida Rodolfo Palenque de la zona Villa Dolores de la ciudad de El Alto. Vive junto a su esposa, la cual trabaja como comerciante, tiene dos hijos de 16 y 14 años respectivamente. El crédito lo destinara para la compra de repuestos de su movilidad. Trabaja como garzón en el restaurante de el aeropuerto de la cuidad. Es el segundo crédito con Impro y la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgarle el préstamo

loans.use: Purchase of spare parts for his vehicle.

loans.name: Teofila

texts.es:
Teofila is a seamstress. She makes embroidered tags for articles of clothing and also makes belts for women and men. She makes these items by the dozens in the markets of the city of La Paz. The sales from the markets are her source of income that she uses to support her two children who are dependent upon her. She lives in the Portada area of the city of La Paz.

The loan requested will be used to buy prime materials such as thread and leather, to fulfill the orders that she has for the parties at the end of the year. This is the fifth loan with IMPRO. The prior loans qualify her to be approved for this loan request.

Translated from Spanish by Kim Baker, Kiva volunteer.

Teofila es costurera; realiza bordados de etiquetas para prendas de vestir y tambien confecciona cinturones para damas y caballeros que comercializa por docenas en las ferias de la ciudad de La Paz; esta actividad es su fuente de ingreso con la que mantiene a su dos hijos que dependen de ella; vive en la Zona de la Portada de la Ciudad de La Paz. El crédito requiere para comprar materia prima hilo y cuero para satisfacer la cantidad de pedidos que tiene por las fiestas de fin de año. Es el quinto crédito con Impro, los antecedentes anteriores le facultan para aprobarle la solicitud realizada por el prestatario.

loans.use: Purchase of thread and leather for her business.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for IMPRO - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Pablo

texts.es:
Pablo is a mason in the city of El Alto. His wife sells mid-quality children's and adult clothing in the market of the Ceja area in the city of El Alto. The earnings from the clothing sales are the source of income used to support their three children that are of school-age and who depend on their parents. He lives in the Chamaco Chico area of the city of La Paz.

The loan is being requested to increase the amount of and accumulate more merchandise to sell for the markets of the Christmas season. In this way, they can increase their sales and generate more income for their family.

This is the 6th loan with IMPRO. The prior loans qualify him to be approved for his loan request.

Translated from Spanish by Kim Baker, Kiva volunteer.

Pablo trabaja como albañil en la Ciudad de El Alto; la esposa es comerciante de ropa para niños y adultos de mediana calidad en la feria de la Ceja de El Alto. Esta actividad es su fuente de ingresos con la que cubren la manutención de sus tres hijos que están en edad escolar y que dependen de la pareja; vive en la Zona Chamaco Chico de la Ciudad de La Paz. El crédito requiere para incrementar mercadería y acumular para las ferias navideñas de esa forma incrementar sus ventas y generar mayor ingresos para su familia. Es el sexto crédito con Impro, los antecedentes anteriores le faculta para aprobarle la solicitud realizada por el prestatario.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for IMPRO - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Rashad

texts.en: Rashad (his father is pictured) is a single man who lives in Salyan region, in the Khaladj village. This man has 8 years of experience in farming. Now he needs a loan of $1200 to buy  vine props.

loans.use: To buy vine props

loans.name: Victor E.

texts.es:
Client History: Victor has a vehicle that serves as a radio taxi for the APOLO company. His wife is a businesswoman. Their home is located in the village of Armonia. The business offices of the radio taxi are located in the village of Copacabana outside of the city of La Paz.

This is the second time that he has requested a loan. The amount requested will be used for the purchase of tires and the complete maintenance of his vehicle. His job allows him access to this loan, as he already has experience as a driver. Driving the taxi generates sufficient income to cover the loan and his personal needs.

Translated from Spanish by Kim Baker, Kiva volunteer.

Historia del Cliente: Victor tiene una movilidad que trabaja como radio taxi de la empresa APOLO; su esposa es comerciante. Su domicilio se encuentran ubicado en la zona de villa Armonia; las oficinas de la empresa de radio taxi están ubicadas en la zona de Villa Copacabana de la ciudad de La Paz. Es segunda vez que solicita un crédito. El monto solicitado será destinado la compra de llantas y el mantenimiento completo de su vehiculo. Su trabajo le permite acceder a este crédito ya que tiene experiencia como chofer. Esta actividad genera ingresos suficientes para cubrir el préstamo y para sus necesidades personales.

loans.use: Purchase of tires and maintenance of his taxi.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for IMPRO - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Nancy L.

texts.es:
Client History: Nancy has a stand where she sells jackets by the dozen. Her home is located in the Pampahasi area and her stand is located on Tumusla Avenue in the city of La Paz. This is the first time that she has asked for a loan. The amount will be used to buy jackets and t-shirts. Her experience in her job allows her to be able to request this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Kim Baker, Kiva volunteer.

Historia del Cliente: Nancy tiene un puesto donde vende chamarras por docena y al detalle. Su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en la zona de Pampahasi y su puesto esta ubicado en la av. Tumusla de la ciudad de La Paz. Es la novena vez que solicita un crédito. El monto solicitado será destinado para la compra de chamarras y poleras Su experiencia en la actividad que desempeña le permite acceder a este crédito.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her business.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for IMPRO - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Elvira A.

texts.es:
Client History: Elvira has a shop where she sews clothes for women, such as: blouses, jackets, suits and mending in general. Her home and shop are located in the Miraflores area in the city of La Paz.

This is the third time that she has asked for a loan. Her prior loans qualify her as a client; in other words, she has paid back her loans and fulfilled her obligation. The requested amount will be used to purchase prime materials like: fabric, linings, thread, zippers, trimmings and hooks and eyes. Her job allows her to request this loan, in that she already has experience as a seamstress and generates sufficient income to cover the loan and her particular needs.

Translated from Spanish by Kim Baker, Kiva volunteer.

Historia del Cliente: La señora Elvira tiene un taller donde realiza todo trabajo de costura para damas, como ser vestidos blusas, chamarras, trajes y arreglos en general. Su domicilio y taller se encuentra ubicado en la zona de miraflores de la ciudad de La Paz. Es la Tercera vez que solicita un crédito Su antecedente crediticio lo califica como cliente 1 es decir con cumplimiento bueno en el pago se su obligación. El monto solicitado será destinado para la compra de materia prima (tela, forro, hilo, cierre, adornos, y broches) Su trabajo le permite acceder a este crédito ya que tiene experiencia como costurera y genera ingresos suficientes para cubrir el préstamo y sus necesidades particulares.

loans.use: Purchase materials for her sewing shop.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for IMPRO - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Florencia

texts.es:
Florencia lives in her own house with her husband and her youngest son in the Plan Autopista neighborhood of the Vizcacha area in the city of La Paz. She works making shawls out of her home. She doesn't work alone, but rather there is a woman who knits and makes the finished product with fringe, trimmings, etc. in addition to making the yarn by spinning the vicuña wool (an animal similar to the llama or alpaca). The loan that she is requesting will be used to buy material so she will be able to make shawls in greater quantities.

Because of her previous history (with IMPRO) she can request a new loan, as she is considered a preferential client. She has been a client of IMPRO since 2005.

Translated from Spanish by Kim Baker, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Florencia vive en casa propia con su esposo y su hijo menor en el plan autopista de la zona Vizcacha ni de La Ciudad de La Paz; se dedica a la confección de mantas en su domicilio , pero en la elaboración de las mismas ella no trabaja sola, hay una señora que teje y ella realiza el terminado de la misma con flecos, trencillas etc. además de haber hilado la lana de vicuña. El crédito que solicita es para compra de material y poder elaborar mantas en mayor cantidad. Por su antecedente Histórico puede acceder a un nuevo crédito, ya que se considera cliente preferencial. Es cliente de IMPRO desde el año 2005.

loans.use: Purchase materials to make shawls.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for IMPRO - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Javier

texts.es:
Javier lives in a rented place in the city of La Paz. He paints small landscapes and does pencil sketchings, whichever his clients request. His income is limited, so he has decided to sell his paintings with framing and glass so that they have more value. The credit he requests is to buy materials (wood, glass and canvases).

An evaluation has qualified him for this new loan. Javier has already had 2 previous loans, which have been repaid in full.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer.

Javier vive en alquiler en la calle Ángel Dávalos de la zona de Tembladerani de la ciudad de La Paz; la actividad que realiza es el arte de pintar cuadros pequeños de paisajes y además realiza el dibujo en lápiz según lo que le pidan sus clientes. Sus ingresos son reducidos por lo cual decidió vender sus pinturas con marcos y vidrio para que tenga mas valor; el crédito que solicita es para comprar material (madera y vidrio y lienzos).

La evaluación realizada lo califica para acceder a un nuevo crédito. Javier ya obtuvo dos créditos anteriores los cuales a la fecha están cancelados en su totalidad.

loans.use: Purchase of wood, glass and canvases.

loans.name: Wilmer

texts.es:
Wilmer lives in his own home with his wife and son on May 27 Avenue in Periférica in the city of La Paz. He works at a financial institution and the loan he's requesting is to buy a computer to be able to realize his accounting jobs, since he is studying to better himself and to be able to increase his income.

He doesn't have a credit with Impro but qualifies to receive one.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Wilmer vive en casa propia con su esposa e hijo en la av. 27 de mayo de la zona Periférica de la ciudad de La Paz; trabaja como empleado en una institución financiera y el crédito que solicita es para comprar una computadora y así poder realizar sus trabajos de contabilidad ya que esta estudiando por que desea superarse y poder aumentar sus ingresos.

No tiene crédito con Impro pero califica para acceder a un crédito.

loans.use: Purchase of a computer for his accounting studies

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for IMPRO - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.es:
Vicenta lives in her own home with her three children on Mario Alborta street in the Tembladerani district of the city of La Paz. She sells food, perfume and electronics in schools and in her neighborhood. She delivers her goods on credit and collects money on a daily basis. She will use this loan to increase her capital so that she can offer a wider variety of products.

She does not have a loan history with Impro but the socioeconomic analysis conducted qualifies her to receive this loan.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer.

La señora Vicenta vive en casa propia con sus tres hijos en la calle Mario Alborta de la zona de Tembladerani de la ciudad de La Paz. Su actividad es la venta de víveres, perfumes, artefactos eléctricos, ya sea en los colegios y por su zona entregándolos al crédito y cobrando diariamente , el crédito que solicita es para aumentar su capital y así tener más variedad de productos para ofrecer.

No tiene antecedente histórico con Impro pero por la evaluación socio económica efectuada ella califica para obtener un préstamo.

loans.use: Increase capital to purchase more merchandise.

payments.comment: Early pay off. Vicenta is applying for a new loan.

loans.name: Francisca P.

texts.es:
Francisca Paulina lives in a house she owns, with her husband and children, in the km.7 street of the Alto San Pedro region of the city of La Paz. She works as a secretary at the soccer school and her husband works at a radio station. The requested loan will be used to pay her son’s school tuition deposit, as well as to repair the ceiling of the house, which is leaking badly during this rainy season.

She is considered a very good customer and, thanks to her credit history, she is eligible for another loan.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

Francisca Paulina vive en casa propia, con su esposo y sus hijos, en la calle kilómetro 7 de la zona de Alto San Pedro de la ciudad de La Paz; trabaja como secretaria en la escuela de fútbol y su esposo trabaja en una estación radial. El crédito que solicita es para pagar la reserva en el colegio de su hijo y parte del mismo lo usara para reparar el tumbado de la casa, ya que en esta época de lluvias gotea mucho.

Por su antecedente histórico puede acceder a un nuevo crédito y se la considera muy buena cliente.

loans.use: Payment of her son's school tuition fees and repair of her house ceiling.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for IMPRO - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Etih

texts.en: Etih is 31 years old and a mother of one child, aged 12. She sells flavored ice sticks, and can earn US$3 per day. Her husband, A., is a driver who earns US$2 per day. She has to work hard to earn extra income for the family. Etih requests a loan to expand her business. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Sri

texts.en: Sri is 28 years old and a mother of one child, age 7. She sells cosmetics on credit. She can earn US$5 per day. Her husband, A., sells vegetables and can earn US$15 per week. She needs a loan of IDR 900,000 to expand her business. The loan will be used to buy more goods and to buy more various vegetables. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To buy more cosmetics and various vegetables

loans.name: Enung

texts.en: Enung is 35 years old and a mother of one child, aged 16. She sells sheets and blankets on credit and usually earns US$5 per day. Her husband, A., is a laborer who earns a small income. Enung requests a loan of IDR 900,000 to buy more goods to sell, so she can earn more money for her child's education. She is a member of MBK and is willing repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To buy more sheets and blankets to sell

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en: Amalia is 35 years old and a mother of a child aged 18. She produces and sells cakes by putting them at several shops, from which she can earns US$5 for each order. Her husband, E., is a driver who earns US$50 per month. She requests a loan of IDR 500,000 and hopes that with this loan she can produce more various cakes to sell. She is a member of MBK and is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To produce more various cakes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Add to her product line and have more sales during the Christmas season.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Fix the roof in their school.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of merchandise to increase sales.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James, aged 36, is a professional driver engaged in a motorcycle transport business. He was formerly employed as a taxi driver for six years. James says, ‘Life was not easy’. He had to collect a fixed amount of money every week to pay the car owner. This created so much pressure that sometimes he couldn’t take anything at home for his family after failing to get customers. Therefore, James resorted to joining a motorcycle transport business three years back. Today, he owns an old motorcycle and he can realize some daily income and is assured of employment. He operates at Wandegeya, a suburb of Kampala, the capital city of Uganda. The street is very busy and it’s strategically located near the major university called Makerere, where students are his main customers.

James has a family of four children, two boys and two girls, aged between 16 to 3. All the children are at school. He wishes to work hard to ensure that they all go to college.

He wishes to borrow $600, which he is planning to supplement with his own savings to purchase a new motorcycle to cope up with customers' needs. (University students, who are his biggest customers, prefer nice new model motorcycles.) SAO MFI (u)Ltd will top up the loan as requested by the client. He says he will be able to pay back the loan in six monthly installments.

With time, he hopes to use the profits to set up a grocery for fresh fruit, greens and local food.

loans.use: Purchase of new motorcycle Bajaj CC 100

loans.name: Ramiro

texts.es:
”At my age, I have not been able to find employment. That is why I decided to open up a store in my home, and my wife helps me. I actually have very little merchandise so I would like to invest some money so that I may increase sales and obtain good earnings, being that my wife and I live off the profits of this store. I am requesting $450 to invest in the purchase of merchandise for my business.”

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

“A mi edad ya no he podido conseguir trabajo es por eso que decidí poner una tienda en mi casa y mi esposa me ayuda en realidad tengo muy poca mercancía así es que me gustaría invertir un poco para poder vender más y obtener buenas ganancias ya que de esta tienda vivimos mi esposa y yo” Solicito $ 4,500.00 dlls para invertir en la compra de mercancía para mi negocio

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for my store.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Fundación para la Vivienda Progresiva (FVP), a partner of CHF International - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Luz Maria

texts.es:
"I sell fried chicken at my business. My husband and I opened it one year ago and it has gone very well for us. Right now we would like to invest in the purchase of more merchandise and to obtain more profits since this is what sustains our family." I am requesting a loan of $1,200 to invest in my business.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

“Tengo en mi negocio vendo pollo frito, lo abrimos mi esposo y yo hace 1 año y nos ha ido bien, pero en esta temporada nos gustaría invertir en la compra de más mercancía Y así obtener más ganancias ya que es el sustento de nuestra familia”. Solicito $ 1,200.00 dlls para invertir en mi negocio.

loans.use: To invest in the purchase of merchandise

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Fundación para la Vivienda Progresiva (FVP), a partner of CHF International - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es:
"I have a room in the back of my home that I would like to construct out of cement blocks so that we may inhabit it and so my children will be more comfortable. Our home is very small, we are a family of 5 and we no longer fit comfortably. I am requesting $1,200.00 to construct a room made of cement in my home."

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

“Tengo un cuarto atrás de mi vivienda que me gustaria hacer de block, para poder habitarlo y que mis hijos esten más comodos ya que nuestra vivienda es muy pequeña y en mi familia somos 5 y ya no cabemos ”. Solicito $ 1,200.00 dlls para hacer un cuarto de block en mi vivienda

loans.use: Construct a room made of cement.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Fundación para la Vivienda Progresiva (FVP), a partner of CHF International - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Ma De Los Angeles

texts.es:
"I have a business in my home where my children and I live, since I am a single mother. I would like to invest in my business so my sales will increase and to be able to have a better quality of life to offer to my children. I need to buy more merchandise that my clients are asking me for but because of lack of money I haven't been able to buy. I am requesting $1,100 to invest in my business."

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

“Tengo un negocio en mi vivienda y de ahí vivimos mis hijos y yo ya que soy madre soltera, me gustaría invertirle a mi negocio para que mis ventas aumenten y poder tener una mejor calidad de vida que ofrecerles a mis hijos, necesito comprar más mercancía que mis clientes me piden y por falta de dinero no he podido comprar”. Solicito $ 1.100.00 dlls para invertir en mi negocio.

loans.use: To invest in the purchase of merchandise for her business

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Fundación para la Vivienda Progresiva (FVP), a partner of CHF International - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Odette Amani

texts.en: Odette Amani A. is a 59-year-old widow. Odette is a farmer in Sassandra, a rural city on the south-west coast of Côte d'Ivoire. She cultivates cassava on about 2 hectars of land belonging to her family. Cassava is one of the main products in the Sassandra region, where it is used for different types of foods. Odette, who produces a big quantity of cassava, is confronted by a problem of conservation. She would like to get a loan in order to build small conservation silos  against rats and insects under her hangar. She said that this will help her to conserve part of her production for a lean period. Odette is dynamic and hard worker.

loans.use: Odette Amani Ahou will use the loan to develop a storage space for cassava

loans.name: Eldaniz

texts.en: Eldaniz G. lives in the Ashigli village of Beylagan, a small city in southwestern Azerbaijan.  He is 33 years old.  Eldaniz is engaged in cattle-breeding.  He has some cows and now wants to increase the number of his cows.  Eldaniz needs a loan in the amount of $500 for buying one cow.

loans.use: To buy one cow

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Norwegian Microcredit LLC (Normicro) - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Fuzuli

texts.en: Fuzuli G. lives in the Ashigli village of Beylagan, a small city in southwestern Azerbaijan.  He is 36 years old, married and has two children.  Fuzuli has been engaged in animal-breeding for a long time.  He has some cows and some sheep.  Fuzuli has borrowed 4 loans from Normicro Beylagan Branch in the past and repaid these loans timely.  Now he needs a loan in the amount of $900 for buying ten sheep.

loans.use: To expand business

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Norwegian Microcredit LLC (Normicro) - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Medet

texts.en: Medet M. lives in the Ashigli village of Beylagan, a small city in southwestern Azerbaijan.  He is 47 years old, married and has three sons.  He is engaged in sheep-breeding.  He has 20 years of experience in this business.  His sons help him at his business.  Medet wants to increase the number of his sheep.  To do this, he has applied to Normicro Beylagan Branch for a loan in the amount of $900.

loans.use: To expand his business

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Norwegian Microcredit LLC (Normicro) - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Famil

texts.en: Famil R. is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from Khojavend city in Azerbaijan.  Now he is settled with his family in Beylagan, a small city in southwestern Azerbaijan. He is 51 years old, married and has three children.  Famil has a lorry and he is earning a living for his family by carrying luggage with his lorry.  Famil needs a loan in the amount of $500 for repairing his lorry.

loans.use: To develop his business

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Norwegian Microcredit LLC (Normicro) - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Bintou

texts.en: Bintou C. lives in Sassandra, a rural city on the south-west coast of Côte d'Ivoire. Bintou is married and has 5 children. She has been selling fruits and vegetables in Sassandra market for years. Bintou is assisted in her business by her elder daughter. Her husband is retired from the post office. Their younger children still go to grammar school. Bintou is currently the main household revenue provider. She is rigorous and well organized. She would like to wholesale crop production to Abidjan through a cooperative of women who will assist her for transportation.

loans.use: Bintou Camara will use the loan to purchase goods

loans.name: Hagigat

texts.en: Hagigat R. lives in the Dashburun village of Beylagan, a small city in southwestern Azerbaijan.  She is 48 years old and has four children.  Her husband died a few years ago.  She is engaged in animal-breeding.  She has some cows and some sheep.  Hagigat wants to increase her number of sheep.  To do this, she needs a loan in the amount of $700.

loans.use: To expand her business

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Norwegian Microcredit LLC (Normicro) - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Ulker

texts.en: Ulker A. is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from Fuzuli city of Azerbaijan.  Now she is settled with her family in Beylagan, a small city in southwestern Azerbaijan.  She is 45 years old, married and has two children.  She is engaged in cattle-breeding.  She needs a loan in the amount of $600 for buying one cow.

loans.use: To expand her business

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Norwegian Microcredit LLC (Normicro) - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Leyla

texts.en: Leyla is a mother of 2 children who lives in the Salyan region in the Khaladj village.  She was born in 1969.  Leyla has 10 years of experience in the farming business.  Now, she needs a loan of $1200 to buy fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Sakit

texts.en: Sakit (his father is pictured) is 36 years old, married and has 2 children.  He has run his farming business for 7 years.  D.'s family lives in the Salyan region in the village of Yenikand.  Now, he needs a loan of $1200 to buy a plot of land for improving his farming business.

loans.use: to buy a plot of land for improving his business

loans.name: Ramiz

texts.en: Ramiz is a single man who has his own farming business.  This man lives in the Salyan region in the Khaladj village.  This 26-year-old man is requesting a loan of $1200 for buying fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy food and resell

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for HELP Africa - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Sakhib

texts.en: Sakhib (his son is pictured) has his own grocery store.  He was born in 1950.  This man has 3 children.  Sakhib lives with his family in the Salyan region in the village of Khaladj.  10 years ago, he started this business to support his family.  Now, he needs a loan of $1200 to buy foodstuffs.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs

loans.name: Shukur

texts.en:
Shukur was born in 1968.  He has 10 years of experience in the farming business.  He is married and has 3 children.
 H.'s family lives in the Salyan region in the Yenikand village.  He wants to improve his business and to do this, he has applied for a loan of $1200.

loans.use: to improve his farming business

loans.name: Vidadi

texts.en: Vidadi (his sister is pictured) is married and has 3 children.  This 37-year-old man lives with his family in the Salyan region in the village of Yenikand.  He has run his farming business for 10 years.  Now, he requests a loan of $1200 to buy fertilizer for improving his farming business in order to support his family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Elnara

texts.en: Elnara lives in the Salyan region in the Khaladj village.  She was born in 1982 and is single.  Elnara has 4 years of experience in the farming business.  Now, she needs a loan of $1200 to buy vine props.

loans.use: to buy vine props

loans.name: Raya

texts.en: Raya is a widow with 5 children.  She lives in the Salyan region in the Yenikand village.  20 years ago, she started her farming business.  This woman was born in 1949.  Now, Raya needs a loan of $1200 to buy a plot of land to get a rich yield and to be able to meet the needs of her children.

loans.use: to buy a plot of land

loans.name: Mustafa

texts.en: Mustafa (his mother is pictured) is married and has one child.  H.'s family lives in the Salyan region in the Yenikand village.  He has run this business for 7 years.  Now he needs a loan of $1200 to buy fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Siti

texts.en: Siti K. is 30 years old and the mother of a child aged 8. She collects and sells waste and scrap materials for a living. She can earn US$ 12 per day, while her husband, Mawi, always helps her run her business every day. She is requesting a loan of US$ 75 to expand her business and she's planning to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To expand her little recycling business

loans.name: Onah

texts.en: Onah is 40 years old and the mother of a child aged 13. She produces and sells cakes and also brings them to several shops, earning about US$ 15 per week. Her husband, S., is a laborer who only earns a small income. Onah has to work very hard to earn extra money to support her family. She is requesting a loan of US$ 100 so she can produce more varieties of cakes. She is a member of MBK and is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To produce more varieties of cakes

loans.name: Edah

texts.en:
Edah is 32 years old and the mother of a child aged 15. She sells beverages such as mineral water, soft drinks, etc. She can earn US$ 15 per day. Her husband, B., is a laborer who only earns a small income.

Edah has to work hard to help her husband cover their family's needs. She is requesting a loan of US$ 125 to buy more goods for her stall and she's willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To buy more beverages for re-sale

loans.name: Tini

texts.en: Tini, 25 years old, is the mother of a child aged 9. After becoming a member of MBK, she began selling meatballs and snacks. She usually earns about US$ 9 per day and that is barely enough for her daily needs. Her husband, R., earns a small income each day. Tini is requesting a loan of US$ 100 to expand her business and she's willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To expand the offerings of her little meatball stand

loans.name: Yoyoh

texts.en: Yoyoh, 36 years old, is the mother of a child aged 16. After she became a member of MBK, she began selling meatballs. She usually earns about US$ 5 per day and that is barely enough for her daily needs. Her husband, O., also sells meatballs, going around to various places to offer his meatballs for sale. Yoyoh is requesting a loan of US$ 75 to expand her meatball business and is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To expand her little meatball business

loans.name: Sri

texts.en: Sri P. is 30 years old and is the mother of a child aged 12. She sells detergents on credit. Her husband, Usman, is a farmer who earns US$ 2 per day and their two incomes are barely enough to cover their daily needs. Sri has to work hard to help support her family, so she is requesting a loan of US$ 75 to expand her business. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To expand her little detergent business

loans.name: Sumiati

texts.en: Sumiati, 29 years old,  is the mother of a child aged 9. She raises chickens at her house, feeding them for some time before she sells them. Her husband, W., works at a repair shop and earns US$ 5 per day. Sumiati needs a loan of US$ 75 to buy more chickens to raise so she can expand her business. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To buy more chickens to raise for sale

loans.name: Niyameddin

texts.en: Niyameddin M. lives in the Ashigli village of Beylagan, a small city in southwestern Azerbaijan.  He is 28 years old, married and has one son.  He is engaged in cattle-breeding.  Niyameddin needs a loan in the amount of $350 to buy one calf.

loans.use: To expand business

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Norwegian Microcredit LLC (Normicro) - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Khalil

texts.en: Khalil G. lives in the Ashigli village of Beylagan, a small city in southwestern Azerbaijan.  He is 46 years old, married and has three children.  He is engaged in sheep-breding.  Khalil has 20 years of experience in this business.  He wants to buy some sheep to expand his business.  To do this, he needs a loan in amount $600.

loans.use: To expand business

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Norwegian Microcredit LLC (Normicro) - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Ramazan

texts.en: Ramazan O. is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from Fuzuli city of Azerbaijan.  Now he is settled with his family in Beylagan, a small city in the southwestern Azerbaijan.  He is 24 years old and is single.  He is engaged in cattle-breeding.  Ramazan needs a loan in the amount of $350 for buying one calf.

loans.use: To expand business by buying one calf

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Norwegian Microcredit LLC (Normicro) - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Suleyman

texts.en: Suleyman N. is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from Aghdam city of Azerbaijan.  Now he is settled with his family in Beylagan, a small city in southwestern Azerbaijan.  He is 49 years old, is married and has three children.  Suleyman is engaged in cattle-breeding, and he now wants to increase his number of cows.  To do this, he is requesting a loan in the amount $800 for buying one cow.

loans.use: To expand business by buying a cow

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Norwegian Microcredit LLC (Normicro) - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia B. is in her early forties, and she and her husband have seven children, three boys and four girls. Her three boys are professionals and the girls attend school.

Julia has a stall in the public market where she runs her business. She sells plucked chickens. “That’s a very useful and profitable business”, she says. Two times a week, she goes to Santo Domingo, the capital, to purchase live chickens. Then, her patio becomes a true slaughterhouse where animals are killed and gotten ready to be sold. With a great sense of humor, she explains that business is successful because "Dominicans eat chicken as any human being needs water to survive”. In fact, chicken is one of the most often prepared dishes of this country.

Julia is requesting a loan to purchase more chickens to sell, especially during the holidays. She hopes she can get the funds before long to be sure she will increase her income and keep on helping her daughters attend school. In the past, Julia has proved to be an honest person. She has already taken a loan from FSMA and was able to repay it successfully.

loans.use: To purchase chickens to supply her little butcher shop

loans.name: Faustina

texts.en:
Faustina is fifty years old, and she has three sons. The eldest, 28, is working as tourist guide at Bávaro, one of the most visited touristic sites of the country. Her two other sons, 27 and 18, are living with her and are not working. Her husband is dead.

Faustina is a very responsible and hard-working woman. Six months ago, she took a loan from FSMA with which she started a very small business, selling vegetables and fruits. Her business has grown so fast that she has been able to add a large range of green vegetables, and so she gets a lot of customers.

With this, her second loan requested, Faustina will buy more goods so that she can keep on satisfying her customers’ needs. She hopes she can have the financial flexibility to help her youngest son attend a good university next year in Santo Domingo.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables and fruits to supply her business

loans.name: Maribel Peralta

texts.en:
Maribel is married and has an only son, 22, who is living outside the country. Her husband works as truck driver for a brewery. Maribel sells an assortment of clothing, presently catering to women.

In the morning, she walks along the streets selling jeans, T-shirts, shoes, and underwear. A few months ago, the entrepreneur obtained a loan from FMSA to increase her inventory and better serve her customers. As a good businesswoman, she has managed to make her business more profitable and repay the loan in a timely fashion.

Currtently, Maribel is asking for a second loan to purchase men’s clothing to expand her women’s clothing offerings. She thinks that diversifying her inventory will attract new customers and help her increase her income.

loans.use: Purchase men´s clothing to vary her business inventory and attract new clustomers

loans.name: Marta Abad

texts.en:
Marta is twenty-four years old, and she and her husband have three children who all attend school. Her husband works in the city council.

Marta has recently begun selling paintings with loans she obtained from our organization. She has to travel outside her community to get the paintings or pictures on the wholesale market and then she retails them in the public square.

Marta envisions her business becoming a big shop with a large range of paintings to offer her customers. With her loan, she will buy more goods, especially drawings closely related to Christmas, to sell during the holidays.

loans.use: To buy paintings to supply a small store

loans.name: Fabiana De Los Santo

texts.en:
Just one year ago, Fabiana didn’t have any idea about where and how to gain access to capital so she could start selling homemade sweets (candies).

Currently she has been operating her business for 5 months, ever since she found out that she could obtain loans from FSMA. Fabiana, 36, defines herself as an assiduous and energetic person who struggles to provide food and education for her five children.

Fabiana hopes her business will grow rapidly and that she can get a lot of new customers. She is requesting a second loan to buy ingredients needed in order to prepare more goods and increase her income.

loans.use: To buy ingredients necessary to prepare candies for her business

loans.name: Santa Alcántara

texts.en:
Santa is twenty-five years old, and she and her partner have three sons who range in age from one to five years old. Santa has been running a pastry shop for five years. She operates her business within her house. As she wanted to expand her business and diversify what she has for sale, Santa took a loan from FSMA which she invested to add pâtés and empanadas to the business. She sells the latter products in the afternoon in the public square.

Santa envisions her business becoming one of the best known and most frequently visited pastry shops in her community. Once she gets a locale, she will operate her two businesses in the same place. The entrepreneur wants to increase her income to keep on providing education for her sons and to pay for her studies at the public university in Santo Domingo.

loans.use: Purchase ingredients needed to keep on preparing and selling pâtés and empanadas

loans.name: Hilaria Martínez

texts.en:
Hilaria is a many-sided businesswoman. She owns Uniflores, a small store where she sells artificial and decorative flowers. She also dedicates herself to the sale of Avon beauty products. She is thirty-three years old, and she and her husband have four daughters who range in age from 7 to 15 years old. They all attend school.

Every day, people from her neighborhood visit Hilaria’s store to purchase her beautiful flowers. In the afternoon, she visits some women to promote and sell the Avon products. Currently, she makes a weekly profit of about US$ 150.

Hilaria hopes her business can grow so that she can greatly increase her income. With the loan requested (her second one from FSMA), she plans to buy more beauty products to satisfy her customers’ needs. She is also thinking about starting to sell women’s shoes via catalog. She told us that doing business is the only way one can get to be financially independent. She would also like to be able to continue her nursing studies at the university.

loans.use: purchase artificial flowers to supply her business

loans.name: Ordaliza Lima

texts.en:
Ordaliza is a very young entrepreneur and mother of two girls (ages 8 and 2) and a 6-year-old boy. Contrary to the great majority of women here, Ordaliza says the fact of being a mother won’t impede her in continuing her studies. Twice a week, she goes to Santo Domingo to attend classes at the university.

Ordaliza sells vegetables, spices, and ripe fruit. Her stall is always very crowded, and people who visit her once always want to come back because of her wisdom and empathy. She says she sells for more than 1000 Dominican pesos daily (about US$ 30).

The entrepreneur is requesting a loan to purchase more goods to offer to her clientele and so that she can attract new customers. In the past, Ordaliza has proved to be an honest, reliable person. She had already taken a loan from FSMA and was able to repay it without problem.

loans.use: To invest in the purchase of vegetables and fruits to supply her small business

loans.name: María Encarnación

texts.en:
María is thirty-nine years old, and she and her husband have five children, four of them boys, ranging from twelve to twenty-two years old. For six years, María has been selling women’s clothing. She says that it's a very lucrative business.

Every Tuesday, María goes outsiD. her community to purchase the goods she will resell in her neighborhood. She told us that she makes a weekly profit of about US$ 170.

The entrepreneur has requested a loan to purchase clothing in bulk in Elías Piña, a frontier city with Haiti where garments can be obtained at very low prices. She hopes someday she can have her own locale where she can run her business and no longer have to rent one.

loans.use: to be invested in buying clothing in bulk for re-sale

loans.name: Modesta Peralta

texts.en:
Modesta is married and has three grown-up children (ages 34, 30, and 20). The two elder ones are married and living with their families. The youngest son lives with his mom and goes to the university in Santo Domingo, the capital.

For more than three years now, Modesta has been selling men´s and women´s apparel, mostly pants and shoes. She says she started the business specially to support her youngest son´s studies.

Every day, friends and neighbors from her community visit her home to see and buy her goods. She says the customers are satisfied with the quality of her clothing. Currently, she has a well-established clientele. Her weekly profit is about US$ 100.

Modesta would like to be able to sell more and attract new customers. With this second loan, she will buy clothing in bulk in Santo Domingo to resell in her community. Modesta envisions her business becoming a big clothing store in a few years with a big and beautiful locale.

loans.use: Purchase clothing in bulk for re-sale

loans.name: Sixta

texts.en:
Sixta is in her early fifties and is a single mother of seven daughters. They all are working.

Sixta runs a general store that she started fifteen years ago. Her store is well known and people visit it every day to purchase rice, vegetable oil, milk, chocolate, and a large assortment of basic foodstuffs. She also sells plucked chickens and boiled beans. Sixta says she has got a lot of experience and skills from these years of running her business. She used to sell on credit but people often took unfair advantage of her kindness and they didn´t want to pay on time. Now, she only takes cash.

Sixta needs funds to re-supply her store with a lot of products such as beer, rice, and sugar because those goods are running out. This will be the second loan she will have taken from our organization. Sixta has a good credit history and we are sure that she will manage to make her business grow and repay this second loan successfully . Her dream is to have a big store with a very big clientele, where she can sell a large assortment of goods.

loans.use: Purchase goods to supply a general store

loans.name: Dileysi Mateo

texts.en:
Dileysi is thirty-four years old, and she and her husband have five children, four of them boys, who range in age from six to fourteen years old. They all attend school.

Dileysi dedicates herself to the preparation and selling of sandwiches, pâtés, hot dogs and natural juices. She has been running this business for more than five years. About six months ago, she took a loan from FSMA which she invested in the purchase of ingredients and new kitchen utensils. She repaid the loan successfully.

Now, Dileysi can provide better services to her customers, and the food is prepared in very good, hygienic conditions. The entrepreneur hopes her business can keep on growing. With this second loan she has requested, she will buy ingredients to prepare her sandwiches and she says she is working hard to make her business better and attract new clientele.

loans.use: Buy ingredients to produce her sandwiches

loans.name: Aurora Mateo

texts.en:
Aurora´s motto is ‘Striving for Excellence’. This nice, hard-working woman is twenty-seven years old, and she and her husband have three children, two of them boys. Her husband works for a construction company.

Aurora started her first business one year ago, selling vegetables at the public market place. As business was very profitable, and with her husband´s help and funds received from FSMA, she opened a small cafeteria.

Every day, people of the surroundings visit her cafeteria to get spaghetti, sandwiches, boiled manioc with eggs or with chicken, and so forth. Currently, both of Aurora's businesses are going well and she was even able to hire two girls to help her in the cafeteria while she is attending to the vegetables selling.

The entrepreneur is requesting a loan to buy ingredients to keep on running her cafeteria. She envisions her business growing a lot and being one the most often visited cafeterias of her community. She says that her big dream is to have a lot of business so that she can both earn a better income herself and provide jobs for people in the neighborhood.

loans.use: Purchase food ingredients to keep on producing food for her little cafeteria

loans.name: Alejandrina Manzueta

texts.en:
Alejandrina sells empanadas, pâtés, sandwiches and juices in the public square in her community. She is a 36-year-old single mother of five children, two of them girls. They all attend school. This business activity is the principal source of income of the entrepreneur. She says she learned the meaning of working hard to make a living and care for a large family.

Alejandrina doesn´t plan on having her own locale yet. She says she can’t afford it for now. She will keep on selling at the public square and attracting new customers by offering new and varied types of empanadas.

With her loan, Alejandrina will buy raw materials to keep on running her business activity with the aim of reaching a comfortable lifestyle for her family.

loans.use: Purchase raw materials to prepare her sandwiches and  juices

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana is an experienced businesswoman. She is in her early fifties and has ten grown-up children, six of them girls. Four of her children are married and have their own families. The six elder ones are still living with mom.

Juliana has been running a general store for more than thirty years. Her business is well known in the neighborhood and she has a very large clientele. People visit her store frequently to get all kinds of products, from basic foodstuffs to goods such as insecticides, razors for shaving, and phone cards.

The entrepreneur needs funds to invest in the purchase of many goods to supply her store. She has already taken one loan from our organization, and she proved herself to be an honest and responsible person, since she repaid the loan punctually.

loans.use: to purchase various goods to supply a general store

loans.name: Oliva

texts.en:
Oliva is a 58-year-old widow, mother of eight children, four boys and four girls. They all are grown up and are working, some of them outside the community.

Oliva is running a cafeteria that she started three years ago. She says she had wanted to have this business for a long time, but she didn´t have access to capital, so she had to wait for the appropriate moment.

Six months ago, Oliva took a loan from our organization and was able to radically change her business. With her loan, she bought a lot of kitchen utensils and now she can prepare the food in good, hygienic conditions. Oliva hopes her business can become so much more profitable that she can hire a girl to help her with the preparation of the food.

With this, her second loan, she plans on purchasing food ingredients to keep on running her business and varying the menu to attract new customers.

loans.use: purchasing food ingredients for her little cafeteria

loans.name: Fary Antony Muñoz

texts.en:
Fary runs a ‘colmado´, a general store where people can buy foodstuffs such as rice, beans, spaghetti, vegetable oil, and other goods. She has been operating the business for four years. Fary is twenty-five years old, and she and her husband have two sons, ages 2 and 6. The elder attends school.

Fary explains that before, her store was very small, but she was able to enlarge it with the last loan she took from FSMA about six months ago. Now, the store is more spacious and people can purchase their necessities more comfortably. Fary is requesting a new loan to purchase big quantities of many goods that she runs low on in her store. The entrepreneur says that in the long run, she would like to buy the locale where she operates the store, since it´s a rented one and not hers.

loans.use: to replenish inventory that is running low in her grocery store

loans.name: Cirila Helidania

texts.en:
Cirila, 29, is married and has two boys, ages 7 and 8. Her husband works in a cement factory.

For seven years, Cirila has been selling women´s clothing and fashionable shoes to the members of her community. She gets the goods outside the community, mostly in Santo Domingo, the capital; sometimes she goes to purchase garments in Elías Piña, a border town in Haiti where goods can be obtained at very low prices.

Currently, Cirila sells her clothing at a flea market since she doesn´t have her own locale where she can run her business. She hopes that in a few years she will be able to buy a locale where she will run her ´big store´.

With the loan requested here (her second one with FSMA), she will purchase clothing in bulk so that she won´t have to make as frequent trips outside her community to get those goods.

loans.use: Purchase clothing in bulk to resell in her community

loans.name: Blasina

texts.en:
Blasina is forty-five years old and has four children, three of them boys. The three elder ones work and the youngest attends school. Blasina has been separated from her husband for seven months.

With the first loan she obtained from FSMA, Blasina invested in the purchase of raw materials and some new cooking pots and an old oven so that she could keep on operating her small sandwich and hamburger business. Now her business is very profitable and she has managed to attract a lot of loyal customers.

This entrepreneur now wants to enlarge her business further. She has requested a second loan to buy ingredients to continue preparing sandwiches and to offer new sorts in order to attract new clients and increase her income.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients to continue producing sandwiches, etc.

loans.name: Shahnoza

texts.en:
R. Shahnoza has a successful business selling cleaning goods. She used her first KIVA loan to put a roof over her place of business and to expand her stock. She said that KIVA lenders have given her the opportunity to make her living conditions better. Her business is going well and she makes a stable profit. She is requesting a loan of $1200 to further expand her stock before the New Year holiday.

Click here to see Shahnoza's first loan with Kiva and MLF MicroInvest: Business ID 8428

loans.use: To increase stock before the New Year holiday

loans.name: Marach Din

texts.en: Marach Din lives in district 10 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married and has four children: two sons and two daughters. He is uneducated, and he is a farmer. He has lots of land to cultivate, but he is unable to cultivate all his land, so he requested an individual loan to buy seeds and fertilizers to work hard on his land. He wants to make a good income to help his family and enroll his children in a better education center. He is happy with all parts of his family.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth O. is a 35-year-old entrepreneur and mother of six school-aged children. She lives in Rongo, Kenya. She began her current business of selling second-hand clothes ten years ago. She specializes in women’s clothing: skirts, dresses, casual clothes, and bed sheets. She periodically travels to Nairobi, where she is able to purchase a good variety at wholesale price.

The prime location of her business on a busy street, her ten years of experience, and her friendly interaction with customers has enabled her to establish a good customer base. Ruth plans to expand her business with her next loan of US $800.

loans.use: Expand the business

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Kisumu Medical & Education Trust (K-MET) - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan O. is a 50-year-old mother of eight school-aged children. She lives with her husband, who is a retired banker, in Rongo, Kenya.

Before beginning her current business of selling second-hand bed linens and curtains in 1990, she worked as a clerk with Lake Basin Development Authority. Susan runs her business on a busy street along Rongo-Homabay Road. She specializes in selling bed sheets and curtains. She is able to purchase a good variety at wholesale prices in Nairobi. Susan plans to expand her business with her next loan of US $800.

loans.use: Business expansion

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Kisumu Medical & Education Trust (K-MET) - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en:
Pamela is 35 years old, is married, and lives with her husband and three school-aged children in Rongo, Kenya.

Pamela has successfully repaid two microfinance loans from K-MET. She used the funds from her first loan to open her own beauty salon in 1998, and it has expanded since then. She currently rents the shop seen in this picture. She also sells shoes, purses, ties, and other clothing items.

The central location of her shop and her many years of doing good business within the community has earned her a good reputation and a wide customer base. Her business has done quite well due to the added advantage of access to loan funds; she has combined the additional money with hard work and perseverance in order to increase her stock and materials and build a successful income-generating business.

Pamela is proud of her accomplishments and proud that she is now able to contribute to paying household expenses. Pamela requests a loan of US $ 1000 to further expand her business.

loans.use: Business expansion

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Kisumu Medical & Education Trust (K-MET) - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Hamid Allah

texts.en: Hamid Allah lives in district 9 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married and lives with his own family. He has a car parts shop, and he has been working in this business more than 5 years. During the last 5 years he attracted a lots of clients, but he was unable to complete his stock. He has requested an individual loan to complete his stock. He wants to make a good monthly income to help his family. He is happy. He would like to thank AFSG.

loans.use: To complete his stock

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel O. is a 38-year-old father of three children. Joel lives with his family in Rongo, Kenya. He started his dressmaking and tailoring business in 1988. Through his hard work he has managed to acquire two sewing machines. He specializes in making women's and men’s clothes. The central location of his shop, together with nineteen years of doing good business within the community, has earned him a good reputation and a wide customer base.

Joel successfully repaid one previous microfinance loan from K-MET. With a second loan of US $ 700 from K-MET, he can expand his business to include a training site for students to learn dressmaking. He intends to purchase 2 more sewing machines and increase his stock of dressmaking materials so he can meet the growing demand of customers.

loans.use: Buy two additional sewing machines and increase the stock of dressmaking materials.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Kisumu Medical & Education Trust (K-MET) - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a 56-year-old married mother of six children. She lives with her husband in Rongo, Kenya. She started her cereal business in 2002. She purchases cereal, such as maize, beans, millet, ground nuts, and green grams, in bulk during harvest season when prices are low and sells to the consumers when prices go up.

Her hard work, perseverance, good reputation, and many years in business coupled with a well-established customer base ensure that her business will continue to grow despite stiff competition. She has applied for a loan of US $ 1000 to purchase in more cereal in bulk to add to her inventory, and save some to use in case of unforeseen circumstances.

loans.use: Puchase cereal to sell

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Kisumu Medical & Education Trust (K-MET) - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Subgroup D Of Group Tegemeo

texts.en:
Dorothy S., age 37, is married with 4 children (ages 14, 12, 5, and 2). About a year ago, she started her own tailoring business. Before this, she was taking tailoring classes and was selling sodas and sarongs. Her husband works as a clerk for a local organization.

Her tailoring business, where she sews and continues selling sarongs, is open from around 9am to 5pm daily. She charges about $4.80 for each piece she sews and currently makes a profit of around $18-27 per month from both her tailoring work and from selling sarongs. She uses her profits to increase her stock of sarongs and to pay the shop rent of about $14 per month.

Dorothy is the leader of Subgroup D of group “Tegemeo” (Swahili for “expectation”), which totals 21 members. She will be sharing this loan with her subgroup members: Jamila A. (selling clothes), Rudia H. (tailoring), Visa J. (selling clothes), Rose K. (selling firewood), Habiba R. (café owner), and Sara R. (selling clothes). She knows her subgroup well as they are neighbors and have shared 2 previous loans which they paid back successfully.

Dorothy used the 2 previous loans to buy a sewing and embroidery machinery, which initially got her business up and running. When her subgroup receives the new loan, she hopes to use it to increase her stock of sarongs during this Christmas season.

In the picture, Dorothy is in the back row, second from the right.

loans.use: To buy sarongs

loans.name: Thi Duyen

texts.vi:
Ms Duyên is 25 years old, married with 1 young child. She is a hard working woman. She sells bean curd at the market near her house. Not to waste the husk and the bran from bean curd production, she also raises pigs for meat and also sows for breeding. In her pigpen there's a few dozens pigs/piglets anytime. Her husband works in construction, his salary adds up to the family income. Ms Duyên wishes to receive the loan to buy pig mash.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Duyên 25 tuổi có chồng và có 1 con nhỏ. Chị là người phụ nữ khá năng động. Chị làm đậu bán ở chợ gần nhà, tận dụng bã đậu, chị chăn nuôi thêm. Chị nuôi lợn nái và cả lợn thịt. Chị không cần phải mua lợn giống vì lợn nái nhà chị đã có thể cung cấp đủ. Lúc nào trong chuồng cũng có vài chục con lợn. Chồng chị làm thợ xây cũng có thể phụ giúp thêm thu nhập trong gia đình cùng chị. Chị rất mong muốn được vay vốn và trả góp dần.

loans.use: Mua cám cho lợn

loans.name: Tita

texts.en: Tita is 18 years old and has a small shop where she sells snacks, household goods, cigarettes, rice and many other things. She can earn US$8 per day, due to the amount and variety of goods in stock. Tita requests a US$75 loan to fill her shop. Her husband, F., doesn't have a fixed income and only does odd jobs. She is a member of MBK and is willing to repay this loan within 12 months.

loans.use: To fill her shop with more inventory

loans.name: Ikah

texts.en: Ikah is 43 years old and has a child aged 13. She raises and sells chicken livestock at her house.  Her husband, M., is a laborer who earns a small income. She requests a US$75 loan to expand her business. She is willing to repay this loan within 12 months.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Rukmini

texts.en: Rukmini is 28 years old and has a child aged 7. She sells goods such as cooking oil and noodles in her small shop. She usually earns US$7 per day. Her husband, D., earns US$2.50 per day by taking people on his motorcycle. She requests a US$75 loan to buy more goods to fill her shop. Rukmini is a member of MBK and is willing to repay this loan within 12 months.

loans.use: To fill her shop with more inventory

loans.name: Amah

texts.en: Amah is a 49 year old widow. Her husband passed away so now she has to work to support herself. She has a small shop which sells fresh food and household goods. She usually earns US$10 per day and it's just enough for her daily needs. She requests a $100 loan to expand her business. Since Amah became a member of MBK, her business is done increasingly well. She is willing to repay this loan within 12 months.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Nuryati

texts.en: Nuryati is 36 years old and has a child aged 16. She sells household goods such as cooking oil, rice, and eggs and usually earns US$25 per day in profit. Her husband, H., sells vegetables in Jakarta and could earn US$10 per week. She is a member of MBK and requests a $100 loan to fill her shop with more inventory. She is willing to repay this loan within 12 months.

loans.use: To fill her shop with more inventory

loans.name: Khanlar

texts.en:
A. Khanlar was born in the Gubadli region, which is now in the Azerbaijan-Armenian conflict territory and situated in the west part of the Azerbaijan Republic in the Caucasus region.  Right now, he lives with his family in Sumgayit city.  He is 48 years old and father of two children.  His elderly father and mother live with him as well.  He is the only breadwinner of his family. 

He started his bread baking business in 1997.  Having borrowed a loan in 2005 for the amount of $500 from Normicro, he expanded his business.  A second time, he borrowed $800 and made repair works to his business place.  The loans were both paid back timely. 

Now, he would like to receive a $1200 loan in order to buy necessary equipment for his business and increase his number of clients.  He will repay the loan within 12 months.  He hopes to eventually expand his business, which will further improve the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: in order to buy necessary equipment for his business and increase the number of clients

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Norwegian Microcredit LLC (Normicro) - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Tohirjon

texts.en: Tohirjon A. has been an active client of MicroInvest since 2002. He has an expanding business selling shoes in the J.Rasulov district. He requests a loan of $875 to increase the quantity and variety of his shoe stock.

loans.use: Increase the assortment of shoe stock

loans.name: Wawat

texts.en: Wawat is 33 years old and has a child aged 16.  She sells kerosene and can earn US$10 per day. She also sells some spices such as pepper, garlic, etc. and puts them at the market and earns US$20 per day. Her husband, S., is an employee in Jakarta who earns US$40 per month. She has to work hard to earn extra income for the family. She requests IUS$125 loan to expand her business and is willing to repay this loan within 12 months.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Dilafruz

texts.ru:
Dilafruz A. has been selling women's clothing since 2003. Despite her young age she has been successful in her business. Her business's development is illustrated by the growth of her revenues which shows that she has been good at using her working capital. Dilafruz uses her loans to increase her product assortment, in order to not lose customers and to attract new ones. She always tries to get new products and to be competitive.

Dilafruz recently married and her husband helps her to transport her products. He has his own business and together they plan to save money to purchase an apartment. (In the photo you can see Dilafruz on the right, pictured on the left is her sister). When Dilafruz found out about KIVA she asked for an additional loan to purchase new products. Since she has been successfully paying back her current loan from MicroInvest, the committee has approved her for posting on the KIVA site.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva volunteer.

Дилафруз Артикова занимается продажей женской одежды с 2003 года. Несмотря на то, что она молодая, она достаточно умело ведет бизнес. О развитии её бизнеса можно наблюдать по росту её активов, что свидетельствует о хорошем обороте денежного капитала. Полученные займы от нашей организации она полностью вкладывает в расширение ассортимента, чтобы не потерять клиентов и привлечь новых. Она всегда старается обновлять свой ассортимент и быть конкурентоспособной. Она недавно вышла замуж, и её муж помогает ей с транспортировкой товара. У него отдельная торговая точка и они вместе планируют накопить деньги на будущую квартиру.(На фото она с права, со своей сестрой) Она узнав о сушесвовании такой программы как КИВА,попросила дополнительный займ на закупки нового ассортимента товара,Так как она успешно погашает свой текущий займ c Микроинвеста, на комитете этот клиент была утвержденна на размешение на сайт КИВА.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Lyum

texts.en: Lyum is 33 years old and a mother of child aged 5. She has a small shop where she sells snacks, household goods, cigarettes, rice and many other things. She can earn US$5 per day. Her husband, B., sells vegetables at the market and usually earns US$3 per day. Lyum requests a US$100 loan to fill her shop with more inventory. She is a member of MBK and is willing to repay this loan within 12 months.

loans.use: To fill her shop with more inventory

loans.name: Araz

texts.en:
H. Araz has been engaged in this business for 6 years.  He is from Sumgayit city, situated in the east part of the Azerbaijan Republic.  He is single and lives with his parents.  

He has his own mini shop and is the only breadwinner in his family because his parents are old.  With this business, he was able to earn some money.  However, this money was enough for only some of his family's basic needs, and he had difficulty covering other family consumption needs.  If he does some repair work on his business place, he will be able to earn enough money for his family.
 
Now, he needs to borrow a loan of $400 to expand his business area, make necessary changes and to repair his workplace.  He hopes that this expandsion will improve the living conditions of his family.  He will repay the loan within 6 months.

loans.use: to expand his business area, to make necessary changes and to repair work place

loans.name: Orziniso

texts.en: Orziniso D. is a mother of 5 children.  She has worked selling clothing in a bazaar for 10 years and is an active client of MicroInvest.  She is a teacher and works in the bazaar after school to supplement her income, as her teacher's salary is too little to support her big family.  Ms. D. is requesting a loan of $1100 to increase her stock.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Dilbar

texts.en: Dilbar H. Nasriddinova lives in the J.Rasulov district with her family.  She has worked in a bazaar for five years selling shoes and clothing.  She buys her goods in Istaravshan.  She is an active and talented salesperson and has many loyal clients.  Dilbar requests a loan of $1175 to increase her stock and attract more clients.

loans.use: Business expansion

payments.comment: Correction due to overpayment for business 27031

loans.name: Shahzoda

texts.en: Shahzoda I. has been in business for seven years selling clothing and shoes in a bazaar.  She started with very little capital and a very small business.  Now her business is expanding.  Mrs. I. requests a loan of $1,100 to buy new goods for the winter season.  She has three children who help her in the bazaar after school.  In the future Mrs. I. wishes to open her own shop.

loans.use: For buying stock of winter clothes and shoes

loans.name: Marhabo

texts.en: Marhabo M. is a mother of 4 children.  She has been in business selling clothing for 14 years.  Winter is a busy time of year at the bazaar where her business is located.  Ms. M. requests a loan of $875 to increase her stock of winter clothing to meet her customers' demand.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Subgroup B Of Tegemeo

texts.en:
NURU, age 28, is the mother of two children (ages 13 and 6). She lives with her children, her husband, her late brother’s 14-year-old daughter, and another 2-year-old orphaned relative. While her husband has a job doing development work for the government, Nuru works from home doing embroidery, knitting, and tie & dye. She makes bed sheets, chair cushions, sweaters, and tie-dyed dresses and sells them door-to-door to schools, offices, and homes.

Nuru started her business over two years ago. Before this business, she fried fish, chapattis, and donuts to sell on the street. Because frying was a hot and tiring job, she finds that her new business suits her much better.

With a roll of fabric, costing about $24, Nuru is able to make a profit of about $20. A roll of fabric makes about 10 pieces of clothing, and it takes about a week to go through the roll. It takes her about a day to make a tie-dyed dress, 4 days to knit a baby’s outfit, and a week to embroider a bed sheet. She generally works from 4am to 4pm every day. Her sister assists her when she has free time. In a month, Nuru makes between $130 and $160.

Nuru spends the profits from her business on her children and toward school fees. She also sends money to her mother who is financially dependent on her. She puts what is remaining in savings with the hope of buying land one day.

Nuru is the leader of Subgroup B of Tegemeo (Swahili for “expectation”). She will be sharing this loan with her subgroup members: Asha A. (market seller), Litambo J. (shop owner), Hamida J. (sells clothing), and Asha I. (sells clothing). This subgroup has taken out 3 previous loans from Tujijenge Tanzania to enhance their businesses, and they were able to pay each back successfully.

Nuru used the previous loans to buy more materials for her business. She now hopes for another loan for the same purpose.

In the picture, Nuru is wearing the bright blue outfit.

loans.use: To buy more knitting material and fabric

loans.name: Karidja

texts.en:
Karidja C. is a 32-year-old dynamic and ambitious woman. She lives with her cohabitant and their 2 children in Sassandra, a rural city on the southwest Atlantic coast of Côte d'Ivoire. Karidja's cohabitant is a truck driver in the Sassandra region.

Karidja has sold vegetables in the market of Sassandra for many years. She is dynamic and contributes significantly to the household expenses. Both of her children go to primary school. She would like to purchase goods in bulk in order to benefit from a lower price and improve her margin. She plans to be wholesaler by purchasing products in bulk in the Sassandra region and delivering them in the Abidjan markets where the demand is always huge.

loans.use: To purchase goods

loans.name: Ligoma Group

texts.en:
Maureen operates a second hand clothes business. She has been in this business for a period of one year and she got her initial capital from an informal rotating savings arrangment which her group used to have. This is commonly referred to as a “merry go round”. This is what she has been using to finance her business and ploughing back profits into her business. She is 29 years old and married with two children.
