Her business location is in a place called Maseno in the Kisumu district. Her business is near a university (Maseno University) and most of her clients are from the university community. She hopes to use the loan to increase her business stock so that she can carry more clothes in inventory of several varieties more consistently. This has been necessitated by the growing market due to increased dependence of the increasing student population on nearby clothes. Her clothes are preferred since they are cheaper than new clothes. She also intends to diversify into selling juice after having established and learned that it is a fast-paying business in the locality.

Maureen uses the proceeds from her business to supplement her family's income as her husband's income is small. Her husband is employed in junior ranks and hence has little money to support the business. She saves part of the income for her children and ploughs back the rest to the business. This is her first loan both for her and for the group. She is a sub group leader and has displayed good leadership skills.

Though this is the first time the group is taking a loan, they have displayed a high degree of cohesiveness during group preparation and training. All members of the group come on time and have shown commitment to follow group policies and procedures.

The location of Maureen's business is very strategic as it is close to the university student community who are most of her customers. Most students and the community around can't afford to buy new clothes and hence her business has a high chance of growth.

loans.use: To increase stock of clothing materials. Diversify in to business of selling juice.

loans.name: Subgroup C Of Group Tegemeo

texts.en:
ASILI, age 46, is married with 5 children (ages 15, 11, 8, 5 and 3). He used to work with Total Petrol Station but had to leave because the station went bankrupt. As a result, he started his own business in 2003, a hardware store called the “Mkopi Store.” The shop is open daily from 7am to 6pm. He hires 2 shopkeepers and pays a shop rent of about $45 per month. He makes a profit of around $273 per month which he uses for home expenses and school fees for his children. He also takes care of his mother who is living with them.

Asili is the leader of Subgroup C of Group Tegemeo (Swahili for “expectation”), which totals 21 members. He is going to share this loan with his subgroup members: Zainabu R. (selling charcoal & fire wood), A. M. (selling charcoal), Colleta M. (shop owner), and Zainabu A. (selling snacks). This subgroup has already shared 2 previous loans which they were able to pay back successfully.

Asili used the previous loans to buy hardware appliances for his shop. With the new loan, he hopes to once again increase his stock.

In the picture, Asili is front row and center.

loans.use: To increase stock of hardware

loans.name: Deborah

texts.en: Deborah Ezekieh is 39 years old. She is married and has four children. She lives in Lagos State, Nigeria. She sells children's clothing. She has been in business since 2003. She is in need of $875 to enable her to buy more children's clothing for sale. She thanks you.

loans.use: Buy more children's clothing for sale.

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en:
Dorothy O. is a 38-year-old widow and a mother of 4, and comes from the Ajamgbadin area of Lagos State, Nigeria. She sells cooked food and drinks to people in her community. She has been in business since 2001.

She requests a loan of $450 to buy more food and drinks to sell. She said it will help her customers if she can offer more for them.

loans.use: Buy drinks and food to sell

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca A. is a mother of 4, 35 years old, and comes from the Shibiri area in Lagos State, Nigeria. She sells clothes and is also a seamstress. She has been in business since 1997.

She has been a member of LAPO for the past three years. She now requests a loan of $700 to buy more clothes to sell and a sewing machine.

loans.use: Buy clothes to sell and a sewing machine

loans.name: Romoke

texts.en:
Romoke B. is a mother of 4, is 34 years old, and comes from the Shibiri part of Lagos State, Nigeria .She sells yams in bulk and has been in business for 6 years.

She requests a loan of $700 to buy more yams to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: Buy yams to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more merchanside for the holiday season.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a 47-year-old widow and a mother of 5, who lives in the Shibiri area in Lagos State, Nigeria. Since 1997, she has had a business selling building materials, such as gravel and sand.

She requests a loan of $450 to buy more gravel and sand to sell.

loans.use: Buy sand and gravel to sell

loans.name: Bolanle

texts.en:
Bolanle A. is a mother of 2, 45 years old, and lives in Lagos state, Nigeria. Since 1997, she has had a business selling provisions and local gin.

Bolanle A. requests a loan of $450 to buy more groceries and local gin to sell.

loans.use: Buy groceries and local gin to sell

loans.name: Delia

texts.es:
Delia and her enchanting husband Florencio have dedicated themselves for the past 4 years to making and selling slips and skirts, a business that through their diligence and perseverance has allowed them to cover the basic needs of their home and offer their three dear children well being and an education. This hard working couple begins laboring daily at 7:00 in the morning until 7:00 at night, making elegant and a wide variety of slips and skirts to later rent or sell them to the townspeople, mainly during the festival days of their hometown, Juliaca, and in some neighboring towns. They wish to obtain a loan to buy a wider selection of lace and continue making their beautiful slips. Let’s help this noble effort so Delia and her enchanting husband can continue making and displaying their elegant and fine articles of clothing.

Translated from Spanish by Lizella West, Kiva Volunteer.

Delia y su encantador esposo, Florencio, desde hace cuatro años están dedicados a la confección y venta de enaguas y polleras, negocio que por su diligencia y perseverancia les ha permitido cubrir las necesidades básicas de su hogar, y sobre todo ofrecerles bienestar y educación a sus tres queridos hijos.Esta laboriosa pareja empieza su labor cotidiana desde las 7:00 de la mañana hasta las 7:00 de la noche, confeccionando elegantes y gran variedad de enaguas y polleras para luego alquilarlas o venderlas a los pobladores, principalmente en los días festivos de su ciudad natal, Juliaca, y en algunos pueblos aledaños.En esta oportunidad desea obtener un préstamo para invertirlos en la compra de mayor variedad de encajes para seguir confeccionado sus bellas enaguas.Colaboremos con este noble afán para que Delia y su encantador esposo sigan confeccionando y luciendo sus elegantes y finas vestimentas.

loans.use: To buy a larger quantity and variety of basic materials (lace) for the production of fine slips.

loans.name: Ganna

texts.en:
Ganna is single with two kids – a 16-year-old and a 14-year-old. She is from Khoost, which is in the western part of the Ukraine. Ganna has been in business selling women’s blouses and shirts for 8 years. She has gained a good reputation in the central town market. Currently, Ganna’s monthly income is about $800.

Ganna’s venture is the only source of income for the family. She tries hard to keep high standards and offers only exceptional quality inventory in her kiosk because competition is very high. Ganna enjoys communicating with her clients and is always willing to meet their needs. She has already received and repaid 12 loans from Nadiya Ukraine without any delinquencies. She is now requesting a loan of $900 to increase her inventory stock and continue to grow as an entrepreneur.

loans.use: To increase clothing stock

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
On Normal Ave. one of the busiest commercial streets in the city of Juliaca, we find 24-year -old Luis, a very enterprising and happy young man, selling his large and diverse quantity of American toys and stuffed animals; a business that he has dedicated himself to for a year. His good judgment in selecting merchandise has led to much satisfaction and happiness in the favorable results he’s been seeing day to day. This young man’s wish is to rent a locale and sell a great variety of toy collections, merchandise that is in high demand during the Christmas season. For this reason he asks for a 6 month loan. Let us support this enterprising youth who wishes to improve his quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Lizella West, Kiva Volunteer.

En la Av. Normal, una de las calles más comerciales de la ciudad de Juliaca; encontramos a Luis de 24 años de edad, joven emprendedor y muy alegre, ofreciendo su inmensa diversidad de juguetes y peluches americanos, negocio al que se viene dedicando hace un año, y que por la buena selección de su mercadería le otorga mucha satisfacción y alegría por los resultados favorables que día a día va obteniendo.El deseo de este joven es alquilar un local y vender una gran variedad de juguetes de colección, mercadería que por estas épocas navideñas tendrá gran demanda. Por esa razón es que solicita un préstamo que se compromete a reembolsarlo en un lapso de seis meses.Apoyemos a este joven emprendedor que busca mejorar su calidad de vida.

loans.use: To purchase a larger quantity and variety of toys.

loans.name: Liliya

texts.en:
Liliya is divorced with two children – a 20-year-old son and a 13-year-old daughter. Her family lives in Stryi. Liliya started her business 2 years ago with the help of her family who provided her with start-up capital. Today she sells women’s clothing in the central market. Her vending kiosk is very popular in the market because Liliya always offers interesting styles of clothing at reasonable prices. Currently, she has about $2000 in inventory. Her gross income per month is about $1800.

Liliya is requesting a loan of $1200 to purchase winter sweaters and jackets wholesale. She is an experienced trade entrepreneur and has a good credit history with Nadiya Ukraine. We believe Liliya will work hard to earn enough money to grow her business and provide decent living standards for her kids which is her ultimate goal as a mother.

loans.use: To purchase winter sweaters and jackets

loans.name: Bariah

texts.en: Bariah is 33 years old and has a 11 year old child. She sells rice and usually earns US$5 per day. She has a large field and it is used to grow rice plants. Her husband, I., sells vegetables in Jakarta, but he usuallly earns money by taking people on his motorcycle in the evening. She is requesting US$100 loan to expand her business and willing to repay this loan within 12 months.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Ysabel

texts.es:
Ysabel is a selfless mother and since her husband abandoned her more than 10 years ago, has dedicated herself to selling prepared foods in the Túpac Amaru market. Thanks to the delicious stews she makes with the help of her adorable mother, this business has brought much happiness because day by day she obtains more regulars. Ysabel, the mother of 5 children, wishes to expand her business and sell breakfast, lunch, and dinner. She believes this expansion in services will offer better income and thus she asks for a loan to invest in this proposition. This enthusiastic mother is waiting anxiously for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Lizella West, Kiva Volunteer.

Ysabel, es una abnegada madre y desde que su esposo la abandonó hace ya más de diez años se dedica a la venta de comida en el mercado Túpac Amaru, negocio que gracias a los deliciosos potajes que realiza con ayuda de su adorable madre viene generándole mucha alegría porque día a día va obteniendo asiduos clientes.El deseo de Isabel madre de cinco hijos es vender desayuno, almuerzo y cena, ella cree que con esta ampliación de ofertas podría obtener buenos ingresos económicos y solicita un préstamo de dinero a fin de invertirlos en este propósito.En estos momentos esta entusiasta madre espera ansiosa por tu ayuda.

loans.use: To by a larger quantity of products in order to also offer breakfast and dinner to the general public.

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Martha is a very active woman who has always worked with the purpose of forming a better future for her children and offering them financial security. She is a mother who has opened a small general store with the help of her husband. Her daily motivation is offering her two children a promising future by way of her work. To reach her goals, she counts on the support of her customers, who frequent her establishment in order to purchase her best products. Martha is dedicated not only to her store, but also to her children’s schooling. Furthermore, she makes time in the evening to help her husband with the cultivation and harvesting of citrus in order to move ahead with the projects they have in mind. She wishes to broaden and equip her general store in order to establish herself economically, so she will keep working zealously and continue helping her husband with their orchards. Let’s support this hardworking mother since she hopes to always provide the best for her family and her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Martha, es una mujer muy activa, siempre ha trabajado con el propósito de forjar un futuro mejor para sus hijos y brindarles seguridad económica. Ella es una madre que con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado abrir una pequeña bodega, con el apoyo de su pareja; su motivación diaria es otorgarles a sus dos hijos un futuro prometedor a través de su trabajo y para lograr sus propósitos cuenta con el apoyo de sus clientes que cada día concurren a su establecimiento a adquirir sus mejores productos. Martha está dedicada a su bodega y a la educación de sus hijos y en las tardes se da un tiempo libre para ayudar a su esposo en el cultivo y cosecha de sus productos cítricos para poder seguir adelante con los proyectos que tienen en mente.Desea habilitar y ampliar su negocio de abarrotes y de bebidas para establecerse mejor económicamente y por ello seguirá trabajando con ahínco y ayudando a su esposo en sus terrenos de cultivo.Apoyemos a esta trabajadora madre ya que espera dar siempre lo mejor a su familia y a sus clientes.

loans.use: Purchase of a wider variety of goods

loans.name: Nataliya

texts.en:
Nataliya is married with three kids aged 13, 9 and 6. She lives in the small town of Korolyovo and works in the central market selling yummy sweets and pastries. Fortunately for Nataliya, she doesn’t struggle with high competition. Moreover, her business has a very favorable location – her stall sits right at the entrance to the market.

Nataliya is very enthusiastic and focused in her work. She started this business because she believed in the idea and was determined to live life without feeling needy all the time. Nataliya loves the idea of serving her customers. She knows the tastes of her loyal clients and always offers them a fantastic range of delicious candy or cookies. Nataliya is requesting a loan of $1200 to increase the assortment of her inventory and hopefully get closer to the winning touchdown of business profitability and stability.

loans.use: To increase assortment of inventory

loans.name: Titilayo

texts.en: Titilayo Saura is 32 years old, married, and a mother of 5. She lives in Lagos State, Nigeria. Since 2003, she has sold drinks and provisions. She requests a loan of $450 to buy more provisions and drinks for sale.

loans.use: Buy more drinks and provisions for sale.

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.en:
Tatyana is married with a 3-year-old son. Her family lives in the small town of Khoost in western Ukraine. Tatyana sells children’s shoes and boots at the local market. She has good sales in her business as footwear for kids of different age groups always sells well. Tatyana has been in business for 7 years. Presently, her monthly profit is about $300.

Tatyana is the only breadwinner in her family. She has to put much effort into this business to make it sustainable and profitable. In the near future, she is hoping to open a small vending store. Tatyana would like to receive a loan of $200 to increase her inventory. Tatyana has promptly repaid each of the 7 loans she has received from Nadiya Ukraine. We believe her integrity, responsibility, and strong Christian beliefs will help her to succeed and repay this current loan without any problems.

loans.use: To increase her stock

loans.name: Eddy

texts.es:
Eddy is an enterprising mother looking to make a better future for the well being of her 5 children that are basis of her motivation to work day to day in the cultivation of her citrus and coffee plants. Even with all the effort she puts into her farm, it doesn’t cover her current expenses due to the illness of her 15-year-old daughter who in the middle of her adolescence has to deal with a speech and hearing impediment. This impediment caused her daughter to abandon her studies, and today Eddy feels her daughter’s pain and suffers at not being able to fully help her daughter due to economic constraints that limit her ability to provide her daughter treatment in the country’s capital. Due to this circumstance she wishes to increase production and thus increase her income in order to provide her daughter with adequate medical attention quickly. Let us fund this self sacrificing mother her loan request and provide her a ray of hope.

Translated from Spanish by Lizella West, Kiva Volunteer.

Eddy, es una madre emprendedora que busca forjarse un futuro mejor para el bienestar de sus cinco hijos, quienes son su fuente de motivación y esfuerza día a día en el cultivo de sus productos cítricos y de café.A pesar del esfuerzo que ponen en su chacra no solventa los gastos que hoy atraviesa, por la enfermedad e su hija de 15 años, quien en plena etapa de su adolescencia trata de lidiar con su dificultad para escuchar y hablar; esta penosa enfermedad hace poco tiempo le obligó a dejar sus estudios y hoy Eddy sufre frente al problema de su hija y por la impotencia que siente al no poder ayudarla plenamente por factores económicos que la limitan a poder brindar a su hija un tratamiento en la capital.A raíz de este penoso incidente desea incrementar su producción para obtener mayores ingresos y llegar a tratar el problema de su hija con prontitud.Ayudemos colaborando con la suma que solicita y brindémosle un rayito de esperanza a esta abnegada madre.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her land.

loans.name: Yance

texts.es:
Yance is a strong man who works hard every day to obtain a good harvest, never wasting a moment of valuable time. Thanks to his efforts he has been able to provide for the well being and education of his family. Yance grows bananas, citrus fruits and mangos to sell to wholesalers. He is requesting a loan to purchase more seeds, increase his production and grow his business. Let's join together to help this hardworking father reach his goals.

Yance, es un hombre de mucha fuerza física, día a día trabaja arduamente para obtener una muy buena cosecha y es por eso que no desperdicia ni un instante del valioso tiempo que posee en el cuidado de sus terrenos de cultivo; gracias al ímpetu que tiene ha logrado sostenerse y brindarle a su familia educación y bienestar. Con su trabajo mantiene eficientemente a su hija y este hecho lo impulsa aún más a seguir labrando la tierra. Él siembra plátanos, cítricos y mangos para ofrecerlos a los comerciantes mayoristas y es por esa razón que aprovecha al máximo el tiempo en el cuidado de sus productos para que en la cosecha pueda obtener excelentes frutos de su arduo trabajo.Su propósito es solicitar un préstamo para incrementar su producción con la compra de más semillas para su cultivo. Solidaricémonos con este increíble padre para que continúe sembrando a fin de que pueda cosechar muchas alegrías

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO PURCHASE MORE SEEDS AND INCREASE HIS HARVEST, GROW HIS BUSINESS AND BETTER PROVIDE FOR THE WELL BEING OF HIS FAMILY.

loans.name: Nunung

texts.en: Nunung is 33 years old and has a 8 year-old child. She has a small shop which sells snacks, food and drinks, along with household products. She earns about US$25 per day, while her husband, H., is a driver in Jakarta who earns about US$10 per week. She requests a US$125 loan to fill her shop with more inventory and also for her husband's business. Nunung hopes that she can increase her income for her children's education. She is a member of MBK and is willing to repay this loan within 12 months.

loans.use: To fill her store with more inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: TO PURCHASE A COPY MACHINE AND MAKE SMALL RENOVATIONS NEEDED TO BETTER SERVE HER CUSTOMERS

loans.name: Eunice

texts.es:
Euneci is a young and enterprising mother who has worked hard to open a store in her community, once she noticed that both she and her neighbors needed a place they could count on for the most urgent basic needs. Thanks to her hard work in the fields, she has been able to realize her dream, and now she and her neighbors can meet their needs. Nevertheless, her small eight year old daughter has many daily needs, and to offer her a better future she has decided to open a business with more products in greater quantities. This will give Euneci larger earnings and will increase her savings, which she will use for the education of her daughter. Her store is on the Shintoriato highway, which is a great help as she has plans to later establish a small restaurant in her community. Lets work with this mother who wishes to improve her business and build a future for her beloved daughter.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva volunteer.

Euneci, es una joven madre emprendedora que con mucho esfuerzo aperturó una bodega en su comunidad, al ver la falta y necesidad de sus vecinos y suyo propio de contar con una bodega que satisfaga sus necesidades más urgentes; gracias a su empeño en sus campos de cultivo pudo concretar sus anhelos y hoy sus vecinos y ella pueden satisfacer sus necesidades.Sin embargo su pequeña hija de ocho años demanda muchísimos gastos día tras día y para ofrecer a su hija un futuro prometedor ha pensado implementar su negocio con nuevos productos de consumo masivo y demás mercadería los cuales proporcionaran a Euneci mayores ganancias e incrementará sus ahorros con los que podrá educar a su pequeña hija.Ella posee su tienda en la carretera de Shintoriato lo cual es de gran ayuda debido a que tiene planes de establecer más adelante un pequeño restaurante en su comunidad..Colaboremos con una madre que desea mejorar su negocio y forjar un futuro a su fruto más querido, su pequeña hija.

loans.use:
Purchase greater quantity and variety of convenience items. 

Compra de mayor cantidad y variedad de artículos de primera necesidad.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: TO PURCHASE MORE MERCHANDISE TO OFFER HER CUSTOMERS, ESPECIALLY DURING THE HOLIDAY SEASON.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Mrs. Esther Okaosro is 40 years old, married, and has four children. She sells provisions and drinks. She has 8 years of experience in business. She is in need of $450 to enable her to buy more provisions and drinks for sale.

loans.use: To buy more provisions and drinks for sale

loans.name: Jesús

texts.es:
Jesus and his wife work together in the cultivation of yuca, something he has done since he was very young. Thanks to his work, he's been able to provide an adequate education for his six beloved children. However, they suffered a tragedy when one of their sons was killed by a car at only 16 years old. This led to a very difficult and depressing time which his wife helped him through. Now, six months on, Jesus is ready to move forward, showing the same dedication as always. For the well being of his remaining 5 children who need him, he is requesting a loan to help increase the production of citrus and other fruits which are in great demand. With your help he can grow his business and provide for the well being of his family.

Jesús, es un noble caballero que en compañía de su pareja, se dedica a la producción de yuca, labor a la que se dedica desde muy chico y gracias a el pudo ofrecer hasta hoy una adecuada educación a sus seis queridos hijos; sin embargo tuvo que atravesar por una dura tragedia, una tarde cuando su hijo salía como de costumbre a estudiar el auto que abordo sufrió un aparatoso accidente y por desgracia su segundo hijo de 16 años perdió la vida. Este fatídico accidente lo llevó a pasar por un duro cuadro depresivo del cual su pareja lo ayudó a salir.Hoy Jesús después de seis meses pudo reponerse y desea seguir adelante mostrando las mismas ganas de siempre, por el bienestar de sus cinco hijos que aún lo necesitan, pero Jesús también necesita de usted para progresar y apela a su buen corazón para obtener un préstamo, con los cuales incrementará su producción de cítricos y frutas que le demandan los grandes comerciantes.No se olvide en apoyarlo él lo necesita.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO PURCHASE SEEDS AND FERTILIZERS TO GROW HIS BUSINESS AND TAKE CARE OF HIS WIFE AND FIVE CHILDREN.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: TO PURCHASE MATERIAL FOR HER EMBROIDERY BUSINESS

loans.name: Felicia

texts.es:
Felicia is a mother of an advanced age, who has given her best years to the cultivation of her land. Thanks to her tireless labor, her children are now receiving advanced studies in the teachers' institute in their city, something that gives her great pride. In spite of that, she knows that to fulfill her role as a mother, she still has an important thing to do. She would like to continue working her land, while acquiring the necessary capital to open a small store in her community. This is something important not only for her, but for them population in the community as well. She hopes to open the store, and to increase her income to invest in the education of her children. You can help Felicia fulfill her role as a mother and one who provides education to her children.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva volunteer.

Felicia, es una madre de avanzada edad, que ha dedicado a sus terrenos de cultivo sus mejores años; gracias a su incansable labor, hoy sus jóvenes hijos cursan estudios superiores en un instituto pedagógico de su ciudad, motivo que la llena de orgullo y satisfacción, a pesar de saber que para culminar su tarea como madre aún le falta un importante trecho; desea continuar trabajando sus terrenos de cultivo y adquirir el capital necesario para aperturar una pequeña bodega en su comunidad, la cual es muy necesaria tanto para ella como para los pobladores de su comunidad.Ella guarda la esperanza de poder abrir aquella tienda e incrementar sus ingresos para invertirlos en la educación de sus hijos. Contribuya a que Felicia pueda cumplir con su papel de madre y educadora de sus hijos

loans.use:
Purchase of larger quantities of seeds, manure, and fertilizer to open her small store soon. 

Compra de mayor cantidad de semillas, abonos y fertilizantes para pronto aperturar su pequeña tienda.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more merchandise for this high sales season.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more raw materials like cloth to make more products during this holiday season.

loans.name: Empat

texts.en: Empat is 35 years old and is a mother of child aged 14. She has a small shop which sells snacks and household goods and usually earns US$20 per day. Her husband, A., sells vegetables in the market and earns US$10 per day. She requests a US$100 loan to expand both their businesses. She is willing to repay this loan within 12 months.

loans.use: To fill her store with more inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: More merchandise for her little store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase chicken feeders, drinkers, heaters, chicken feed, and medicine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To fix up the store that she is integrating into her home

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Invertir en mercaderia

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Expand her store.

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en:
Jacqueline M. is 43 years old, is married, and has four children. She lives in the Kawangware area in Nairobi. Besides her immediate family, she takes care of her 22-year-old sister-in-law, whose mother died. Because Jacqueline’s husband is the eldest in his family, it is therefore his responsibility to take care of his sister, till she finds a job in order to support herself.

Ever since she can remember, Jacqueline had been interested in becoming a tailor. To accomplish this, she joined a training class at Redeemed Gospel Church at Huruma in Nairobi for classes and practical training, which lasted for two years. After training, she started her business in 1996 with about US $147, which she borrowed from her sister. She has since paid that off. She started by making petticoats, which she sold from house to house for a period of six months. The business picked up very well, and with this income she built a stall of her own in Kayole, where she could carry out her business more effectively. She later expanded her business and started making clothes and curtains. And she started offering training; at the moment she has three trainees. Jacqueline was doing well, but unfortunately, her stall was broken into and two of her sewing machines were stolen. Because of this, she had to rent two machines for four months, at about $7 per machine per month. This eventually became too much of a burden and made her business shrink, and she even lost customers. Later she moved from Kayole to Kawangware, and with the money she got after recovering from her loss, she bought a sewing machine.

Jacqueline is now asking for a loan of US $475 to enable her to buy materials and a sewing machine. She says this will enable her to get more students and will also enable her to get back her customers and be able to finish her orders on time. The repayment period for her loan will be 10 months.

loans.use: To purchase a tailoring machine and an assortment of sewing materials

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Action Now: Kenya (ANK) - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more products, especially those for the holidays.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of Christmas merchandise

loans.name: Rosnani

texts.en: Rosnani is 29 years old and is a mother of child aged 13. She sells clothes on credit by going door to door. She usually earns US$7 per day. Her husband, A., is a driver who earns US$2 per day so she has to work hard to cover their daily needs. She requests a US$100 loan to expand her inventory to serve more customers, thereby earning more income for her child's education. Rosnani is a member of MBK and is willing to repay this loan within 12 months.

loans.use: To expand her inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase bales of second-hand curtains

loans.name: Hugo

texts.es:
Description of the Business

M. works selling lubrication products for vehicles. He started this business a year ago thanks to the support of his parents. One of his cousins helps him in the business. Ultimately his location has had great success since he is located on one of the main city bus routes.

Use of the Loan

M. wants to use his loan to invest in merchandise. He wants to have a better selection in his store to better serve his clients, since he always takes care that his clients are satisfied.

Personal information

M. is 28 years old and single. His house is made of cement. His goal is to grow their sales in order to one day have a greater income for his family. He is living in the family home because his father lives in the country.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Descripción del Negocio

El Señor M. se dedica a la venta de productos de lubricación para vehículos, el inicio este negocio hace un año gracias al apoyo de sus padres, en el negocio le ayuda uno de sus primos y últimamente su local ha tenido gran acogida ya que esta ubicado en una de las vías principales por donde circulan los buses urbanos.

Uso del Préstamo

Quiere usar su crédito para invertir en mercadería pues quiere tener surtida su tienda para un mejor servicio a sus clientes ya que el siempre se esmera en que sus clientes se encuentren satisfechos con su local.

Información Personal

Tiene 28 años y es soltero, su vivienda es de cemento y su meta es que sus ventas crezcan para de esta manera un día tener mayores ingresos económicos para su familia ya que el es sustento del hogar por que su padre vive en el campo.

loans.use: To buy lubrication products for his store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine

loans.name: Leni

texts.en: Leni is a 25 year old married woman. Together with her husband, Sadi, she has been producing and selling candied fruits. She usually earns US$10 per day.  In certain seasons, she also sells fresh fruits. Her husband, Sadi, also sells fruit at the market.  She is requesting a US $100 loan to expand her business and is willing to repay this loan within 12 months.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To supply many products for her sales business:  costume jewelry, cosmetics, perfumes, cleaning products, beverages and candy

loans.name: Louise Njambi

texts.en:
Louise Njambi Ndung’u is 39 years old. She is married with four children. Louise lives in South C Estate, Nairobi, where she operates a small shop. Apart from her family, Louise takes care of an aged parent who lives in the rural area of Kikuyu town. On a sad note, Louise’s brother and his wife passed away last year and left behind three children, whom Louise is now taking care of. The children are aged 15, 12, and 8. Because of this big responsibility, Louise has to work twice as hard so that her dependents have enough for their upkeep.

Louise opened her shop in 1980 after saving about US $147, and her husband gave her an additional $75 to help her with the initial capital. She has since repaid the loan from her husband. The business has been doing well, but the price of commodities has increased, and Louise would also like to add stock so that she can provide her customers a greater variety of goods.

Louise is therefore requesting a loan of US $800. With this loan, Louise will be able to purchase flour (maize and wheat), rice, sugar, snacks, sodas, detergents, cooking oil, and more. This will boost her income, since more customers will be flocking to her shop. The repayment period for this loan is 10 months. She thanks Kiva lenders in advance.

loans.use: To purchase assorted stock for a general store, including maize and wheat flour, rice, sugar, snacks, sodas, detergents, and cooking oil

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Action Now: Kenya (ANK) - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase an embroidery machine

loans.name: Dian

texts.en: Dian is 26 years old and is a mother of child aged 7. She sells bags on credit. She goes door-to-door to sell her goods and usually earns US$10 per week. She also sells clothes but only in festive seasons. Her husband, A., also sells clothes in Jakarta and earns  about US$30 per week. She is requesting a US $75 loan to buy more inventory and is willing repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To buy more inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying tools and materials for his workshop (Comprar herramientas y materiales para su taller)

loans.name: Timothy

texts.en:
Timothy is a 24-year-old single man who lives in Mlolongo, a growing town just outside of Nairobi that is situated on the busy Nairobi-Mombasa highway. Besides supporting himself, Timothy also supports his 18-year-old brother.

Timothy started his timber business in November 2006, after his older brother gave him a small loan to buy timber. Previously, Timothy had been selling roasted maize (a popular snack in Kenya) on the street. He began selling maize directly after finishing secondary school and receiving his diploma. His older brother also helped him get started in this first micro-business.

Timothy started his timber business because, while he was selling maize, he noticed that people were bringing timber to Mlolongo from the forests outside Nairobi. With the small savings he had saved from his maize business, Timothy decided to go to the forests to cut wood and bring it to Mlolongo. Since he was successful at the first trial, he decided to open up a timber shop. His shop is very successful, as there are few timber shops in Mlolongo. However, Timothy still has to make frequent trips to the forests near Eldoret (about a five-hour drive from Nairobi) to split wood and bring it back to his shop. Timothy is therefore requesting a Kiva loan of US $1,175 in order to increase his inventory of timber, which would to allow him to remain at his shop without having to make too many frequent trips up-country to gather wood. He is expecting to repay the loan within nine months.

loans.use: To purchase timber in bulk

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use:
Purchase more merchandise for her children. 

Comprar mas mercaderia para sus clientes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase food supplies for her restaurant, including wheat and maize flour, rice, and cooking oil

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase an assortment of sewing materials and ready-made clothes

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Action Now: Kenya (ANK) - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Mayra Alejandra

texts.es:
My house has a wooden roof, but it is quite damaged due to the weather. My house is very damp during this rainy season, so I would like to knock this roof down and build a concrete roof in order to prevent my family from getting sick. I am requesting $1,200.00 to build a concrete roof for my house.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

“Tengo un techo de madera en mi vivienda pero ya esta muy dañado por el tiempo y en estas temporadas de lluvia mi casa esta muy húmeda, me gustaría tumbarlo y construir un techo de concreto para evitar que mi familia enferme debido a tanta humedad” Solicito $ 1,200.00 dlls para construir el techo de concreto en mi vivienda.

loans.use: Construction of concrete roof

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Fundación para la Vivienda Progresiva (FVP), a partner of CHF International - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Celia

texts.es:
I have an only son who no longer lives with me, which means that I live alone in my house. For this reason, I would like to install security bars in front of my home for my own safety because my street is poorly lit and I fear that someone may break into my house. I am requesting $1,200.00 in order to install security bars in front of my home.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

“Tengo solo un hijo y ya no vive conmigo así es que estoy yo sola en mi casa, es por eso que me gustaría poner rejas al frente de mi vivienda por mi propia seguridad más que nada porque en esa calle donde vivo hay muy poca luz y tengo temor de que alguien se vaya a meter. Solicito $ 1,200.00 dlls para poner rejas enfrente de mi vivienda”.

loans.use: Installation of home security bars

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Fundación para la Vivienda Progresiva (FVP), a partner of CHF International - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Juliette

texts.en: Juliette G. has a restaurant in the Sassandra market. Sassandra is a rural city on the southwest Atlantic coast of Côte d'Ivoire. Juliette is married and has three children. She is 38 years old and has been in the restaurant business for years. Juliette's husband is a factory worker in the port of the neighboring city of San Pedro. He doesn't make enough money, so Juliette is then a key contributor to the household budget. Her restaurant is near the central market and most of the salespersons in the market take their breakfast and their lunch in her restaurant. She is very dynamic. Juliette's children all go to school in Sassandra. Her older daughter will take the baccalaureate to end her grammar school studies next year. Juliette is working hard in order to be able to pay for university studies for her daughter.

loans.use: To restock her restaurant with cold drinks and food

loans.name: Ira

texts.en: Ira K. is a 36-year-old-woman. She lives with her partner and their four children in Sassandra, a rural city on the southwest Atlantic coast of Cote d'Ivoire. She sells various housekeeping products in her store in the Sassandra market. Ira is also a member of the women's association of trade development of Sassandra. She is very dynamic and cares for her family and for her brothers, who have been affected by the recent conflict in Cote d'Ivoire. All her four children go to school and she contributes to the education and household expenses. She wants to use the loan to purchase goods in bulk and improve her margin.

loans.use: To purchase goods in buk

loans.name: Ernesto

texts.es:
I am currently living in a relative’s home because I am building two rooms on a plot of land that I bought. However, this construction project is still unfinished due to lack of funds. The project will take me a while to complete, but I plan on working on it little by little because I do not have the resources necessary to finish it quickly. My family urgently needs to occupy these rooms because the house in which we are staying is small and there are many of us living there. I am requesting $1,100.00 to continue the construction of these two rooms.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

“Ahora estoy viviendo en la casa de un familiar ya que estoy haciendo 2 cuartos en un terreno que compre, pero esta sin terminar ya que me va a faltar dinero, es una construcción que me va a llevar algún tiempo terminar pero pienso hacerlo poco a poco, ya que no tengo los recursos necesarios para poder terminar pronto, mi familia tiene la necesidad de habitarlos debido a que la casa en donde nos estamos quedando es muy pequeña y somos muchos los que ahí habitamos. ” Solicito $ 1,100.00 dlls para seguir con la construcción de dos cuartos.

loans.use: Finish construction of two rooms

loans.name: Ndouga

texts.en: Ndouga M. is 43 years old. He lives with his family in Attecoube, a township in the northeast of Abidjan. He has four children. He sells various seasonings and spices. Mr. M. wants to expand his business and purchase goods in bulk in order to improve his margin and revenues. He joined the AE&I microcredit program in July 2005 and has been an excellent performer since then. He has sent all his children to school and hopes to be able to pay for their university studies in the future. Mr. M. is a hard worker.

loans.use: To purchase goods in bulk

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Construction of front brick wall

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Fundación para la Vivienda Progresiva (FVP), a partner of CHF International - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Angel

texts.es:
Mr. Ángel R. is 51 years old and married. He has two children, one grown and the other still in school.

For the past twelve years Ángel has worked as a welder and sharpening items such as meat and wood saws, a trade he learned from his father.

Recently, he received an offer to purchase materials at a very good price, including saws of various sizes. He is seeking a loan to purchase these items.

Next year, he would like to purchase machines to automate his work given that he currently performs all tasks manually with the help of two assistants.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

El señor Ángel R. tiene 51 años, es casado y tiene dos hijos un mayor y una en edad escolar.

Ángel trabaja hace doce años como soldador y afilador, afila sierras de carnicería y carpintería, y el oficio lo aprendió de su padre.

Recientemente ha recibido una oferta de materiales a buen precio que consiste en sierras de distintas medidas, para poder adquirir estos materiales el desea un crédito.

El próximo año tiene pensado comprar máquinas para mecanizar su trabajo, ya que actualmente realiza el trabajo manualmente con ayuda de dos personales.

loans.use: Purchase saws for cutting meat and wood.

loans.name: Flora

texts.es:
About 45 minutes from the city of Juliaca is the town of Pukara, where we can find Flora creating her beautiful and distinctive clay and plaster miniatures. This fine work has brought her years of happiness and satisfaction, as it has allowed her to provide better schooling to her two children. She has given everything to provide from them since she was widowed more than 19 years ago. Now that she is able to enjoy seeing her children working as successful professionals, she would like to create even more of her beautiful ceramic pieces so that she can export them and show the whole world the fine art which she creates with such patience and dedication. In order to realize her dreams, she is requesting a loan, which she will use to purchase raw materials, clay, and paint, so that she can can give a fine finish to each of her pieces. Lets help this wonderful mother to make her dreams a reality.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva volunteer.

A unos 45 minutos de la ciudad de Juliaca está ubicado el pueblito de Pukará, lugar donde encontramos a Doña Flora realizando sus hermosos y distintivos trabajos en miniaturas basado en arcilla y yeso. Este noble oficio le ha traído año tras año mucha satisfacción y alegría ya que le permitió brindarle estudios superiores a sus dos hijos, por los que se consagró únicamente desde que enviudó hace más de 19 años.Ahora con la dicha de ver convertidos en unos exitosos profesionales a sus hijos, desea seguir creciendo con sus hermosos trabajos de cerámica, hasta lograr exportar su mercadería y así mostrar al mundo entero su bello arte, que realiza con mucha paciencia y dedicación.Para concretar sus deseos solicita un préstamo a fin de adquirir mayor cantidad de materia prima, arcilla y pintura, para darle un fino y excelente acabado a cada uno de sus trabajos. Ayudemos a concretar los sueños de esta ejemplar madre.

loans.use: Purchase greater quantities of raw materials.

loans.name: Natalia

texts.es:
At the bus station in the city of Ayaviri we find madam Natalia, a happy mother with a great entrepreneurial spirit. She sells her delicious KanKacho (grilled meat stewed accompanied by baked potatoes) a typical plate unmistakable in that city. For that reason she started it “The Land of Kankacho” Natalia prepares her delicious stew from 2:00 in the morning in order to sell it later from 8:00 until 5:00. While she is busy with her work her husband, Aníbal, is dedicated to the commercialization of ox and sheep. Natalia’s hope is to implement variety for her stand by adding candy, soda, and snacks. Like that she wants to offer a large variety of products to her bus station clients. In order to solidify her plans Natalia and her husband, parents of two children, are soliciting a loan that they will use for the implementation of their business, and at the same time this money will permit her to amplify her business capital for her beloved husband. Together they will try to find a better quality of life for their children.

Translated from Spanish by James Lombardo, Kiva Volunteer.

En el terminal terrestre de la ciudad de Ayaviri encontramos a doña Natalia, madre alegre con gran espíritu emprendedor, vendiendo su delicioso Kankacho (carne asada acompañada de papas al horno) plato típico e infaltable en dicha ciudad, es por esa razón que se la conoce como “ LaTierra del Kankacho”. Natalia prepara su delicioso potaje a partir de las 2:00 de la mañana para luego ponerlos en venta desde las 8:00 hasta las 5:00 de la tarde, mientras ella se desempeña en esta labor, su esposo, Aníbal, se dedica a la comercialización de ganado ovino y vacuno; el deseo de Natalia es implementar con gran variedad de golosinas, gaseosas, galletas su pequeño puesto de Kankacho, y así ofrecerles una inmensa variedad de productos a los concurrentes del terminal terrestre. Para concretar sus planes Natalia y su esposo padres de dos pequeños, solicitan un préstamo que utilizarán en la implementación de su negocio y al mismo tiempo este dinero le permitirá ampliar su capital de negocio a su querido esposo y así juntos tratan de buscar mejorar su calidad de vida y la de sus apreciados hijos.

loans.use: Purchase of more quantity and variety of products

loans.name: Clorinda

texts.es:
From a very young age Clorinda was always a capable girl with many goals in life. In order to better her domestic situation she looked for work immediately after concluding her studies in junior high. Because her parents didn’t have many economic resources to help out financially to fulfill he hopes and continue a professional career. Since then, thanks to the interest, dedication, and altruism that she put into her business it has been doing well. This permits her to offer her young daughter Luz a better quality of life, since she is her principal motive and what gives her drive to work relentlessly. Her ultimate desire is to rent another location much larger to transfer her clientele more comfort. In order to solidify her plans she wishes to obtain a load that she will invest completely in this project. Clorinda hopes to realize her plans with your generous help.

Translated from Spanish by James Lombardo, Kiva Volunteer.

Desde muy jovencita Clorinda, siempre fue una muchacha hábil con muchas metas en la vida. Para mejorar su situación familiar buscó trabajar inmediatamente después de concluir sus estudios secundarios, porque sus padres no contaban con suficientes recursos económicos para que la apoyen a cumplir sus deseos y seguir una carrera profesional, desde entonces, gracias al interés, dedicación y altruismo que puso en su negocio de venta de abarrotes al por mayor está teniendo mucho éxito, permitiéndole ofrecer a su pequeña niña Luz una mejor calidad de vida, puesto que es su principal motor para trabajar incansablemente.El anhelo de esta ejemplar madre es alquilar otro local mucho más grande, para trasladar su mercadería para mayor comodidad de ella y sus clientes. Para concretar sus planes desea obtener un préstamo que invertirá totalmente en este proyecto.Clorinda espera contar con tu generosa ayuda para concretar sus planes.

loans.use: Rent a bigger location for her clients comfort, in order to be able to grant them a better service

loans.name: Marcela

texts.es:
Here we find Madam Marcela in the company of her four adorable children. Weaving with extreme patience and elegance as she makes her beautifully colorful blankets. This is one of the many trades that she dedicates herself to. This hardworking woman also works in agriculture and the raising of livestock, work that she shares with her husband Auturo. Between the two of them they try to give the most of themselves in order to get ahead and prosper. They actually live in a place located in a little town called Ayaviri and their greatest hope is to one day own their own house where they could offer wellbeing and security to their beloved children. To formalize their plans they wish to obtain a loan to increase and consolidate their businesses so that they can increase their profits and finally be able to afford to get their dream house.

Translated from Spanish by James Lombardo, Kiva Volunteer.

Encontramos a doña Marcela en compañía de sus cuatro adorables niñas, tejiendo con suma paciencia y elegancia sus hermosas y coloridas frazadas, uno de los tantos oficios a los que está dedicada esta ejemplar madre.Esta laboriosa mujer también se dedica a la agricultura y a la comercialización de ganadería, trabajo que comparte con su esposo, Arturo, y entre los dos tratan de dar lo mejor de sí para salir adelante y prosperar . Actualmente viven en un domicilio alquilado del pueblito de Ayaviri y el deseo más grande que tienen, estos emprendedores padres, es poseer su propia casita, en donde puedan brindarles bienestar y seguridad a sus encantadoras niñas.Para concretar sus planes desean obtener un préstamo para acrecentar y consolidar sus negocios para que con los beneficios económicos que obtenga construyan su anhelada morada.

loans.use: Investment of capital to consolidate family businesses.  Inversión de capital para consolidación de los negocios familiares.

loans.name: Aquilino

texts.es:
Mr. Aquilino married 14 years ago, and from this union with his loyal wife Daria, two enchanting daughters were born. Since then with much hard work and sacrifice, they were able to buy a vehicle with the intention of offering transportation services to the rural public. In addition, they also decided to dedicate themselves to the commercialization of andean products such as chuño (freeze dried potato product), potatoes, and quinoa, as traveling salesman in their native city Ayaviri and neighboring towns. The dream of this couple is to have more merchandise and a locale in the central market of their town. To reach this objective, they ask for a loan in order to increase the amount and variety of their products and above all acquire their desired sales locale. Aquilino and Daria promise to pay back the loan in 6 months. Let's support them, they're looking forward to your helping hand to move ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Lizella West Kiva volunteer.

Don Aquilino, contrajo matrimonio hace 14 años, fruto de su unión con Daría, su fiel esposa, nacieron dos encantadoras niñas, desde entonces con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio, lograron comprar un vehículo con el fin de ofrecer servicio de movilidad a la población rural, adicionalmente a este trabajo decidieron dedicarse a la comercialización de productos andinos (chuño, papa, quinua) en forma ambulatoria en su ciudad, natal, Ayaviri y pueblitos limítrofes.El deseo de esta pareja es contar con más mercadería y con un puesto seguro de ventas dentro del mercado central de su ciudad. Para alcanzar este objetivo desean obtener un préstamo a fin de aumentar la cantidad y variedad de sus productos y sobre todo adquirir su anhelado puesto de ventas.Aquilino y Daría Prometen reembolsar el préstamo en un lapso de 6 meses, ¡Apóyalos, ellos esperan tu mano amiga para salir adelante”.

loans.use: To buy a larger quantity and variety of andean products to offer in the market of their city.

loans.name: Adela

texts.es:
In spite of living in very difficult times, we can find very enterprising women who, in spite of evil, offer a smile to progress and proceed ahead. Such a one is Adela, who, with her daughter in her arms, leaves daily to work and care for her orange grove. There she makes her living with great care and happiness since she was married. She has great hopes to improve her home and to give her small daughter the best and not leave her in hardship and deprivation. She is motivated to spend her time forging a prominent future for her little girl.

Without a doubt, at some time or other everyone needs a hand. Today she turns to us to request a loan with which she can increase the production of her orange grove in the next year. We can make it possible for this diligent mother to achieve all that she has dreamed of.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Aún a pesar de vivir en tiempos muy difíciles, podemos encontrar mujeres muy emprendedoras, que a pesar del mal tiempo pueden brindarle una sonrisa al progreso y salir adelante, como lo hace Adela, quien con su hija en brazos sale a diario a trabajar y cuidar su terreno de naranjales al cual se dedica con gran esmero y alegría desde que contrajo matrimonio.Ella tiene grandes anhelos de ambientar su hogar y ofrecer a su pequeña hija lo mejor y no dejarla pasar privaciones y carencias, motivo por el cual dedica su tiempo en forjar un futuro prominente para su pequeña.

Sin duda toda persona requiere en algunos momentos de otra que le tienda la mano y hoy recurre a vosotros para solicitar un préstamo con los que podrá aumentar su producción de naranjales para el próximo año.Posibilitemos su petición para que esta diligente madre cumpla todo lo que se ha planteado.

loans.use: To increase the production of oranges

loans.name: Eleodoro

texts.es:
Don Eleodoro always feels an immense satisfaction when the people enjoy his delicious oranges, since he puts in each of his plantations an enormous effort. He possesses a beautiful land where he cultivates the citrus fruits, in company of his family, who are the reason of all the work he does. Don Eleodoro is aware of the needs of his family and for this reason he wants to to open a grocery store in house, so that this business can cover part of the daily family’s expenses. In order to achieve this wish he wants to use the loan to obtain a bigger production of his citrus fruits and to increase the quality. Let's support Eleodoro’s intention to progress.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

Don Eleodoro, siempre siente una inmensa satisfacción cuando las personas disfrutan de sus deliciosas naranjas, , ya que él pone en cada una de sus plantaciones un enorme esfuerzo. Él posee una hermosa tierra en donde cultiva cítricos, en compañía de sus seres queridos, los cuales son la razón de todo el trabajo que realiza, Don Eleodoro es consciente de la M. cantidad de necesidades de su familia y es por ello que tiene en mente abrir una tienda en casa, de manera que este negocio pueda suplir parte de los gastos diarios de su familia. Y para lograr este anhelo el desea el prestamo a fin de obtener M. producción de sus cítricos e incrementar la calidad de los mismos. Apoyemos el propósito de don Eleodoro para progresar.

loans.use: Buy bigger quantities of seeds and fertilizers to improve the quality and production of his products.

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.es:
When we came to the Don Ricardo’s small farm, the first thing that called our attention was the big number of fruit trees that he possesses, and all the immense effort that this man puts in the production of each of his fruits, working with good fortitude and spirit. Ricardo is the father of three daughters who are still in school, they are the reason, he works constantly since he thinks that the best gift that he can give them is a suitable education. Ricardo has always had the desire to be able to build his house in Perené and buy a three-wheeler van to be able to work during his free hours, but he hasn’t been able to do it, due to the multiple expenses he always has. With the loan, Ricardo will be able to have a bigger production of his citrus fruits next year and this way he will be able to achieve his goals. Let's help Ricardo’s dreams come true.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

Cuando llegamos a la chacra de don Ricardo, lo primero que llamó nuestra atención fue la gran cantidad de árboles frutales que posee, y sobretodo el inmenso esfuerzo que este hombre pone en la producción de cada una de sus frutas, laborando con un muy buen ánimo y espíritu Ricardo es padre de tres hijas quienes aún están en etapa escolar, razón por la cual trabaja constantemente ya que considera que el mejor regalo que puede otorgarles es una educación adecuada. Ricardo también ha tenido siempre el deseo de poder construir su casa en Perené y el de comprarse un motocarro, para poder trabajar en sus horas libres, sin embargo no ha podido hacerlo por los múltiples gastos que ha diario tiene. A través de un préstamo, podrá tener una mayor producción de sus cítricos el próximo año y de esta manera podrá lograr sus metas. Contribuyamos a hacer realidad los sueños de Ricardo.

loans.use: Have a bigger working capital to increase the quality and production of his products.

loans.name: Braulia

texts.es:
Mrs. Braulia G. de Gayoso is 38 years of age and is married to Mr. Hugo Gayoso. Together they have two school age children: a boy and a girl.

They own a shop in the Municipal Market of San Lorenzo, where they have been selling clothing such as sweaters, shirts, pants, and children’s apparel for the past 14 years.

Braulia would like a loan for the summer season in order to buy a greater amount of merchandise such as tank tops, sweaters, shorts, and skirts so that she may meet her customer’s demands.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Braulia G. de Gayoso tiene 38 años, esta casada con Don Hugo Gayoso, tienen dos hijos, un varón y una nena menores en edad escolar.

Hace 14 años poseen un puesto en el Mercado Municipal de San Lorenzo donde se dedican a la venta de ropas como remeras, camisas, pantalones, ropas para niños, etc.

Braulia desea adquirir el crédito ya que en esta temporada de verano desea comprar mercaderías en grandes cantidades como camisillas, remeras, shorts y faldas para poder satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes

loans.use: Purchase of sweaters, shorts, tank tops, skirts, etc.

loans.name: Rolando

texts.es:
Farming and the production of fruits are the main activity of most of the settlers of the Peruvian forest. Don Rolando is one of these men, who learned from his parents the skills and secrets of this beautiful activity. This education has now allowed him to be a man with multiple skills for agriculture and most of all it has allowed him to support his dear family in these days of multiple economic problems. He has a partner and his desire is to get married and build a small house and condition it to open a small grocery store to help with the expenses of the house. He is asking for a loan that will allow Rolando to have a bigger income this year and achieve all these goals.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

Gran parte de los pobladores de la selva peruana, tienen como actividad principal el cultivo y producción de frutas, don Rolando es uno de estos hombres, quien recibió de sus padres las técnicas y secretos de esta hermosa actividad, enseñanzas que ahora le han permitido ser un hombre con múltiples habilidades para la agricultura y sobretodo le ha permitido mantener a su amada familia en estos días de múltiples problemas económicos. Él tiene una pareja y quiere casarse y construir su casita, acondicionarla de la mejor manera y abrir una tiendita para ayudar con los gastos en casa. Solicita nuestra ayuda a través de un préstamo que permitirán que Rolando tenga este año mayores ingresos y pueda lograr todas estas metas.

loans.use: Buy more fertilizers.

loans.name: Marisol

texts.es:
The most valuable thing for a mother are her children and the care that they deserve specially when they are very small; therefore Marisol is always paying attention to the needs of her children. She works hard at a small farm that produces Mangoes, and whenever it’s possible she takes her kids with her in order to look after them herself. Maria and her partner work in their own land every day sowing for the different seasons and taking care of the production to then sell it. Marisol will be able to cover her requests and to extend her perspectives if we support her with a loan, let's help with this noble cause.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

Lo más valioso para una madre, son sus hijos y el cuidado que estos merecen son lo más importante principalmente cuando estos están muy pequeños, es por ello que Marisol siempre está pendiente de las necesidades de sus hijos y para esto trabaja muy arduamente en la chacra de producción de mangos y siempre que puede prefiere llevar a sus pequeños con el propósito de observarlos. Tanto ella como su pareja día a día, trabajan en sus tierras sembrando por temporadas y cuidando su producción para luego ofertarlos. Marisol podrá cubrir sus requerimientos y ampliar sus perspectivas si la apoyamos con un préstamo, colaboremos con esta noble causa.

loans.use: Buy seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Celestino's Group

texts.es:
Martha and Celestino are partners of the Yanapanakusun Communal Bank, the quechua word that means “Let’s Help Eachother”, Martha sells candies and popcorn that she makes herself and sells them traveling in the parks and schools when there are events. On the other hand, Celestino works as a teacher in a school far from Ayacucho and it was also far from his family and so he decided to take up carpentry to be with his family. The loans of Celestino and Martha are for 400 soles and 600 soles, respectively, a total that will be invested in the purchase of candies, gum, cookies, caramels, corn, oil, woods, and other materials for carpentry respectively. Celestino will utilize his savings to buy sophisticated machinery, on the other hand the savings that come from Martha are to buy land and construct a house. The dreams of Celestino are to have a sawmill, that his children will become professionals and will be happy, Martha’s dreams are to have another business to sell vegetables, to have her own house and to continue with kids.

Translated from Spanish by Fallon Shields, Kiva Volunteer.

Mirtha y Celestino son socios del Banco Comunal Yanapanakusun, palabra quechua que significa “Ayudémonos”. Mirtha vende golosinas y “canchas palomitas” que ella misma elabora teniendo como insumo al maíz y los vende ambulatoriamente en los parques y colegios cuando hay eventos. Por otro lado Celestino tiene su carpintería, negocio que inició hace 5 años. Antes de este negocio, Celestino trabajaba como Profesor en una escuela lejana de Ayacucho y estaba lejos de su familia y por ello decidió poner la carpintería para estar junto a su familia. Los préstamos de Celestino y Martha son de 400 soles y 600 soles, respectivamente, monto que invertirán en la compra de golosinas, chicles, galletas, caramelos, maíz, aceite, maderas y otros materiales para la carpintería respectivamente. Celestino utilizará sus ahorros para comprar maquinarias sofisticadas, por otro lado el ahorro que viene haciendo Mirtha es para comprar su terreno y construir su casa. El sueños de Celestino es tener un aserradero, que sus hijos sean profesionales y puedan ser felices, mientras que el sueño de Mirtha es tener otro negocio de venta de verduras, tener casa propia y salir adelante con los hijos .

loans.use: The loans of Celestino and Martha are of 400 soles and 600 soles, respectively, the total will be invested in the purchase of candies, gum, cookies, caramels, corn, oil, woods, and other materials for carpentry respectively.

loans.name: José

texts.es:
José is a noble farmer who has worked since he was a young child in the farming fields of his family. His father taught him everything about farming and thanks to this knowledge, today Jose works sowing his land. He fertilizes his land in a natural way. His wife and his two young children are his biggest treasures. They are the reason for which José sees the need to increase his production and to transport his merchandise to the hills like Huancayo. Therefore he needs working capital that will allow him to increase his plantations of diverse citrus fruits that would bring him a bigger income. Let's support this young father who is trying to improve the economic situation of his family.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

José es un noble agricultor que en el transcurso durante la mayor parte de su vida ha trabajado con mucho empeño desde que era niño en los campos de cultivo de su familia, su padre le inculcó los gajes de este oficio y gracias a su sabiduría, hoy José puede desempeñarse de la mejor manera y muy prácticamente en la siembra y cuidado de sus terrenos abonándolos y fertilizándolos naturalmente mientras se pueda. Él tiene un familia conformada con sus dos más grandes tesoros, su esposa y sus dos menores hijos, lo cuales son el motor que le animan a progresar y es por su familia que José ve la necesidad de acrecentar su producción y transportar su mercadería a las zonas de la sierra como Huancayo, es por ello que requiere de un capital de inversión que le permita aumentar sus plantaciones de diversos cítricos que le traerían grandes ingresos. Apoyemos a este joven padre que lucha por mejorar la situación económica de su familia.

loans.use: Buy bigger quantities of seeds in order to increase his production.

loans.name: Lida

texts.es:
Lida is an example of courage. She possesses the enthusiam and entreprenurial spirit that all Peruvian mothers have to progress in the company of her family. With the work that she does every weekend selling clothes at either the fairs or door to door, she has been able to obtain great sales that have allowed her to improve her family's quality of life. However, her income has been shortened slowly due to the low capital that she has. A lot of the garments that she offers had been left with a promise of payment note and this fact had maD. it difficult to continue buying clothes for selling. She asks that we support her with an amount of money to continue to get clothes and garments to sell and introduce at local fairs in her town. Let's be generous and contribute to her petition and let the people of her town continue supporting her by buying clothes from Lida

Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer

Un ejemplo D. valor es Lida, que posee el entusiasmo y espíritu emprendedor que toda madre peruana posee para progresar en compañía D. su familia. Con el trabajo que realiza todos los fines D. semana vendiendo prendas D. vestir en las ferias o D. domicilio en domicilio ha obtenido interesantes sumas D. dinero que le han permitido mejorar la calidad D. vida D. su familia.Sin embargo sus salidas se han ido acortando poco a poco debido al bajo capital con el que cuenta ya que muchas D. las prendas que oferta las deja con un compromiso D. pago y este hecho ha dificultado la compra D. mayor cantidad D. prendas para continuar con su labor. Solicita la apoyemos con una suma D. dinero para adquirir prendas D. vestir a fin D. continuar con su introducción en las ferias D. su ciudad.Posibilitemos su petición y hagamos que las personas D. su ciudad sigan usando las prendas D. Lida.

loans.use: Increase her capital to acquire a larger quantity of clothes to sell to the people of Chachamayo.

loans.name: Vilma Merlin

texts.es:
Mrs. Vilma offers filming and photography services, activities that she learned from her father who was also a photographer. She began this activity 19 years ago because she had to support her daughter, who was born when Vilma was very young, and was studying in the university and because of the responsibilities of taking care of her daughter she could not complete her studies. The services that she offers are filming and photography at baptisms, weddings, graduations and all events that she is hired for, as well as making recordings for promotions. Vilma is a partner of Yanapanakusun Communal Bank, quechua words that means “Let’s Help Eachother”. Vilma tells that she arrived at the Communal Bank because of her friend’s invitation and that she really liked it because she learned how to save. She needs a loan of 3000 soles that she will invest in the purchase of CDs, DVDs, film and cards. Vilma dreams of having a place to develop her photos and to grow her business, to travel outside the country with her husband and daughter to visit her family that she hasn’t seen for many years and that her daughter will become a professional.

Translated from Spanish by Fallon Shields, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Vilma realiza servicios de filmación y fotografías, actividad que aprendió con su papá quién también era fotógrafo. Ella se inició en esta actividad hace 19 años porque tenía la necesidad de mantener a su hija, la cual nació cuando Vilma era muy joven, y estudiaba en la universidad y por las responsabilidades de cuidar a su hija no pudo terminar su carrera universitaria. Los servicios que brinda son filmaciones y fotos en los bautizos, matrimonios, graduaciones y todo evento para el que la contraten, además de hacer recordatorios de promoción. Vilma es socia del Banco Comunal Yanapanakusun, palabra quechua que significa “Ayudémonos”. Vilma cuenta que llegó al Banco Comunal por medio de la invitación de una amiga y le gustó mucho porque aprendió a ahorrar. Ella necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles que invertirá en la compra de CDs, DVD, rollos y recordatorios. Vilma sueña con tener una reveladora para implementar y hacer crecer su negocio, viajar al extranjero con su esposo e hija a visitar a su familia que no ve hace años y que su hija sea profesional.

loans.use: She needs the loan of 3000 soles that she will invest in the purchase of CDs, DVDs, film and cards.

loans.name: Félix

texts.es:
Don Felix is a selfless and hard worker man. Since his childhood and all through his life, he has appreciate the essential value of work. That is the reason that now at his 64 years of age, he continues to have the same diligent spirit. But there is sorrow in his life due to the fact that he and his wife have been unable to have children even though she has gone through a lot of treatments and efforts but that has not decrease his love for her.

He own a small lemon and citrics farm where he works fervently and also sells his products to wholesale buyers. Since young, Felix has been longing for the day that he can have a sugarcane field to produce a raw, unrefined, non-centrifugal cane sugar with a high molasses content called "chancaca". He has been unable to fulfill his dream because some time ago he was swindled out of his savings for it by a fellow countryman that worked with him. He didn't thought for a minute of all the difficulties that Don Felix went through to save that money and took it. Now you have an opportunity to help Felix by contributing for a loan that will amke his dream a reality.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer

Don Félix, es un hombre muy abnegado y trabajador que desde su niñez y durante toda su vida supo apreciar el valor imprescindible que tiene el trabajo, es por ello que aún ahora a sus 64 años, sigue teniendo ese mismo espíritu diligente; sin embargo la tristeza que embarga su vida es el penoso hecho de no tener hijos a pesar del esfuerzo y muchos tratamientos al que se ha sometido su esposo; hecho que no ha generado que su amor por ella disminuya. Él posee una chacra de limones y cítricos donde trabaja muy fervientemente para después comercializar sus productos a los compradores mayoristas.Félix posee un inmenso anhelo en su corazón desde muchacho, y es el de tener un cañaveral para fabricar chancaca, sueño por el que hace un tiempo atrás fue estafado por su paisano, quien trabajaba con él y no escatimó dificultades para llevarse una gran suma de dinero.Ahora vosotros podéis contribuir con Félix para el logro de sus planes a través de un préstamo que le permitirá concretar su sueño.

loans.use: Buying seeds to grow a sugarcane field.

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.es:
Eduardo and his five sons have been making bricks for many years, and he is one of the best producers of artesan bricks in his area. He learnt how to do this thanks to his consciencious nature and diligent spirit that lets him form each brick with perfect patience and perfection. He does this in an awkward space in his home and this sometimes means they are hard to make, so his sales go down. he loves his family very much and works hard each day for them, so that he can give them the best. He knows that in order to do this he must work hard, but he also needs your help in the form of a loan that will let him fit out his work space so that he can make better quality bricks with his fmaily. You can help this man and his family.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteers

La elaboración de ladrillos ha sido por muchos años una actividad realizada por el hombre de manera muy exhaustiva, Don Eduardo, junto sus cinco hijos es uno de los mejores maestros productores de ladrillos artesanales de su localidad; actividad que aprendió gracias a su constancia y E. diligente que le permite formar cada ladrillo con suma paciencia y perfección. Él realiza esta labor en un espacio de su vivienda inadecuadamente preparado, lo que sin duda muchas veces ha dificultado su producción y por ende sus ingresos económicos; ama mucho a su familia y es por ellos que se esfuerza de manera muy amplia durante todo el día, con el fin de darles todo lo mejor; sabe que para ello necesita trabajar más y por esa razón solicita vuestra ayuda a través de un préstamo que le permitirá implementar su taller de trabajo para que pueda preparar mayor cantidad de ladrillos junto a su familia.Vosotros podéis ayudar a este hombre y a su familia.

loans.use: To fit out and improve Eduardo's work space/Implementación y mejoramiento del espacio de trabajo de Eduardo.

loans.name: Eugenia Nora

texts.es:
When we visit Nora she gives us some of her delicious plantains and mangos; products that she has worked hard to get hold of and sell, along with the help of her two young sons. Each and everyday she puts in a lot of effort to her agricultural work as she knows that this is the only way that she can help her two eldest sons at university and so that their family will have a future. It is with this motivation that Nora holds onto her optimism despite economic pressures; her husband's job as a driver does not always cover their costs. Nora feels a great affinity with her family and she really wants to grow more fruits by investing more in them, and this will only be possible with your kind help. It will be very useful and important in order for Nora to realize her and her family's dreams.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Cuando visitamos a Nora, ella nos hizo degustar algunos de sus deliciosos mangos y plátanos productos que a costa de mucho esfuerzo y constancia logra producir junto a dos de sus hijitos, día a día pone mucho ánimo en sus labores agrícolas por que es consciente que de esta manera puede ayudar a sus dos hijos mayores quienes se encuentran lejos estudiando en la universidad con ánimos de encontrar un futuro prominente para su familia, es esta motivación la que inyecta en Nora deseos optimistas y a pesar de las carencias económicas que hay en casa sabe contribuye eficazmente en su aminoramiento, ya que el dinero que gana su esposo como chofer muchas veces no alcanza.Nora siente un profundo compromiso con su familia por lo cual desea alcanzar una mayor producción de frutas a través de una mayor inversión que sólo será posible con su gentil colaboración que será muy útil e importante para que Nora empiece a desarrollar sus sueños y los de su familia.

loans.use: An increase in capital for better production/Incremento de capital para una mayor producción

loans.name: Darling Celeste

texts.es:
Dona Darling is married with a family composed of her husband and one school age son. She began her business because her husband's income was not sufficient to cover the costs of maintaining their home (food, education, health and basic services).

Her business began 5 years ago thanks to an initial loan of CS$5,000.00. Although she owned the location, the conditions were not adequate to operate a business. Nevertheless, little by little and thanks to her efforts, she has been able to improve the infrastructure of the location. Her commercial activity is the sale of pork and its derivatives, as well as fruits and vegetables.
